loans.name: Qui Sait L’Avenir Group

texts.fr: «QUI SAIT L’AVENIR» est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe du nom de Hermionne Vanusta Témileyi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 22 ans. Hermionne Vanusta Témileyi est mariée à un démarcheur du nom de Pierre. Le couple a un  enfant qui n’est pas encore scolarisé et à leur charge. Hermionne Vanusta Témileyi vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari et assure avec son mari les charges de la maison. Hermionne Vanusta Témileyi a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Hermionne Vanusta Témileyi mène comme activité la vente de charbons de bois à son domicile. Hermionne Vanusta Témileyi s’approvisionne au Bénin. Afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse et de se faire plus de profits, Hermionne Vanusta Témileyi sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe « QUI SAIT L’AVENIR » un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: "Qui Sait L'Avenir" is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood and belong to the same tontine [a revolving credit group]. Hermionne Vanusta Témileyi is the representative of the group (her hand is raised in the photo) and is 22 years old. Hermionne Vanusta Témileyi is married to a salesman named Pierre. The couple has one child who isn't in school yet and who they support. Hermionne Vanusta Témileyi lives with her child and her husband and both of them work to cover the household expenses. She left school at the primary level. In order to pay for her various expenses, Hermionne Vanusta Témileyi sells charcoal out of her home. She stocks up in Benin. In order to better meet the demands of her ever-growing customer base and to earn higher profits, Hermionne Vanusta Témileyi is requesting her first loan from Alidé, along with the other members of the "Qui Sait L'Avenir" group.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies appartenant à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sèdé Thérèse est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sèdé Thérèse est âgée de 57 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Simon. Sèdé Thérèse n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a huit enfants, tous scolarisés dont quatre restent à leur charge. Sèdé Thérèse vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Sèdé Thérèse vend depuis vingt ans des poissons de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Sèdé Thérèse s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sèdé Thérèse sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 1, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs  ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The GBENONKPO 1 group is comprised of 3 friends who are members of the same tontine (group savings fund). 

This is the fifth time that this group is asking for financial support from ALIDé in order to grow their business. 

The group representative, Sèdé Thérèse, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Sèdé Thérèse is 57 years old and is married to a mason named Simon. Sèdé Thérèse did not go to school. The couple has 8 children who all went to school, and 4 of them are still under their supervision. Sèdé Thérèse lives with her husband and children. The couple shares the various household responsibilities. In order to contribute to her family's various needs, Sèdé Thérèse has been selling fish on foot for 20 years.

This business allows her to respond to the needs of her family fairly easily. Sèdé Thérèse buys her supplies in the region where she lives. 

With the goal of satisfying her clients and in order to grow her sales and income, Sèdé Thérèse, along with the other members of the GBENONKPO 1 group, is asking for a 5th credit with ALIDé. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 52 year-old poultry farmer in Kiembeni, Mombasa. She is married and has been doing this business for the last three years with success. 

This is her second business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more chicks for raising on her farm. She sells chickens and eggs to her customers. 

The proceeds from the business will be used in the expansion of her business and repaying her loan. She hopes to excel in this business.

loans.use: to purchase more  chicks to raise and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 35 years old.  He is married to Nancy and supports a family of six people.  They are blessed with four children between 2 and 8 years old. Isaac runs a grinding mill (posho mill) and has been in business for six years, earning a monthly income of KES.8,000 from the business. 

This is his third loan of KES.50,000 with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying his previous loans. He intends to use the loan to purchase dry maize for grinding and fuel for running the machine. 


With the anticipated profits from the business he plans to save so as to pay school fees for his children. His hope and dream is to own a retail shop and also to be able to educate his kids.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize for grinding and fuel for the machine.

loans.name: Zikriyo

texts.en: Zikriyo is very intelligent, brainy and hardworking.  For more than 20 years he has been busy growing corn and vegetables. He grows carrots and wheat. He works hardly and grows vegetables of high quality. He sells the harvest at the local market. His customers are happy with his work. Zikriyo has a lovely wife and 2 smart children. His wife and son help him with business. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle for extending his business. He waits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for extending his business

loans.name: Mohammad Ali

texts.en: Mohammad Ali is a 21 year-old man living in Lebanon. He, with his parents and four siblings, make a cooperative and united family.  His father is the only income provider for the family. One of Mohammad Ali’s greatest dreams is to carry on his education until graduation. In that way, he will be able to start his own business and bring added income to the family. He has been working at a local restaurant since 2008. Through his job, he will be able to pay the rest of his study fees. Even then, he finds it really hard to stand on his own. That’s why he asks today to take a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. In that way, he will achieve a good educational level and even pursue higher degrees. With this opportunity, he will start his own business and no doubts a better and new way of living.

loans.use: to pay the rest of his study fees

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 50 years old, married, and supports a family of five people. He has been a maize farmer for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

He is taking out his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use for purchasing farm supplies. 

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua is 69 years old, and she lives in Baclayon, Bohol.  She is a food vendor from her home. She cooks different snack foods and other dishes to sell to her neighbors. 

Perpetua is asking for a loan so she can sustain her business while also looking after her basic needs. She will use the loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, and drinks that she can resell for an income. 

All of Perpetua's children are grown, but she hopes to have a better income, so she will not have to depend on them.  In the future, she hopes to have enough savings so she can retire in comfort.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, and drinks to resell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two children. They are both studying. He strives to work really hard in order to satisfy his family's needs and pay for his children’s study fees. After many years of experience as a carpenter, Mohammad decided to start working on his own in 2006. He’s a reputable person who has gained a fair number of loyal customers so far. He works independently and looks forward to gaining additional projects. Today, he is in need of a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work. He also wants to buy new tools and materials. He notes that this will improve his business and, thus, boost his productivity. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects and better develop his work.

loans.use: To purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work

loans.name: Jully

texts.es:
Jully tiene 26 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa, con deseos de progresar. Su pareja es Carlos, el padre de sus dos hijos. Vive en compañía de sus padres, dos hermanos y sus pequeños hijos, habitando  en la casa de sus padres.

Su actividad es la venta de abarrotes en su bodega instalada en su vivienda, donde ofrece los comestibles de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceites, fideos y otros. Empezó hace más de 4 años, con un capital propio, el cual fue haciendo rotar e incrementar. A pesar que perdió la pierna a causa de un tumor, eso no le quita las ganas de seguir progresando, contando para eso con el apoyo de su madre en la atención. Le gusta su actividad, pues puede contar con un ingreso económico que le permite apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de alimentación y crianza de sus hijos, ya que muchas veces con el ingreso económico de él no les alcanzaba y pasaron algunas necesidades, siendo ayudados por sus padres. Viendo que eso no podía continuar así decidió iniciar su negocio, ahora cuenta con una regular clientela y  tiene planes de ampliarlo y con las ganancias comprarse una pierna ortopédica.

Este es su segundo crédito con la institución MFP. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, para así tener un buen record crediticio. Además, se siente cómoda con su grupo, ya considera sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de una mayor variedad de abarrotes para surtir su bodega como arroz, azúcar, fideos, golosinas, entre otros. Considera que con mayor variedad tendrá más preferencia de sus clientes y mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jully is 26 years old. She is a hardworking and dedicated woman who wants to get ahead. Her spouse is Carlos, the father of her two children. She lives with her parents, two siblings and her children in her parents' house. 

Her activity is selling groceries in her little store where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, eggs, oil, pasta and more. She started more than four years ago with her own capital which she rotated and grew. Despite having lost a leg to a tumor she has not stopped wanting to get ahead. To do this, she has her mother's support for serving customers. She likes her activity because she has income that allows her to help her spouse with the costs of feeding and raising their children. Often, his income hasn't been enough to pay for their necessities and they would get help from their parents. Seeing that this couldn't continue, she decided to open her own business. Now she has regular customers and plans to expand and with the earnings buy an orthopedic leg. 

This is her second loan with the MFP institution. She is committed to making her payments in order to have a good credit history. In addition, she feels comfortable with her group since she considers them to be responsible and supportive people.

With the amount she has asked for,1000 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying a greater quantity of groceries to stock her store, groceries such as rice, sugar, pasta, snacks and more. She considers that with more variety she will gain more customers and more profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, snacks and other edible products to stock her store.

loans.name: Zakariya

texts.en:
Zakariya is 35 years old and married, living with his wife. He’s a hard worker, someone who depends on himself to make money and build a good future for his family. 

Although he earns a fair amount of money, he still faces a tight financial situation.  Zakariya opened his own minimarket in 2005, after being involved in this business for many years. He knows very well how to select his products and serve his customers the best he can. 

Today, he wants to borrow from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy more goods and provisions for his business, such as sugar, soft drinks, dairy products and many other items. He will use this loan to increase his sales and therefore his profits and thus improve his family’s way of living. 

A supermarket will be Zakariya’s second step to grow in his industry and earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy more food products and other items for his grocery.

loans.name: Sinsindagbe 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SINSINDAGBE 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même village. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Mèdégnonwa Charlotte est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mèdégnonwa Charlotte est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Mèdégnonwa Charlotte n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Mèdégnonwa Charlotte est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Benjamin. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges, Mèdégnonwa Charlotte vend depuis dix ans du maïs et de l’huile végétale à son domicile. Mèdégnonwa Charlotte s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mèdégnonwa Charlotte sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SINSINDAGBE 1, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The SINSINDAGBE 1 group is comprised of 3 friends who live in the same village. The group representative, Mèdégnonwa Charlotte, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. 

Mèdégnonwa Charlotte is 35 years old and lives in Benin. Mèdégnonwa Charlotte did not go to school. Mèdégnonwa Charlotte is married to a mechanic named Benjamin. The couple has 3 dependent children, and some of them went to school. The couple lives with their children, and together they take care of the various household expenses. In order to take care of these various expenses, Mèdégnonwa Charlotte has been selling corn and vegetable oil out of her home for 10 years. Mèdégnonwa Charlotte buys her supplies in the region where she lives. 

With the hope of satisfying her clients and in order to grow her sales and income, Mèdégnonwa Charlotte, along with the other members of the SINSINDAGBE 1 group, is asking for a first loan with ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy corn and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Ilva Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Ilva de 32 años de edad, es una humilde ama de casa y comerciante, casada,  originaria de Camoapa-Boaco, actualmente habita en la ciudad de Managua, ella es dueña de una pulpería desde hace 6 años, madre de 4 hijos de los cuales 2 están a su cargo, ella realizo estudios hasta quinto grado de primaria. Ilva inicio su actividad  vendiendo golosinas  a los 26 años de edad, luego debido  a la buena demanda que tenían los productos decide ampliar  mas  su negocio, invirtió en nuevos productos variados especialmente los mas solicitados por sus vecinos, hoy en día gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado poner su propia pulpería en su casa de habitación, siendo este su primer negocio donde recibe el apoyo de sus hijas y esposo que le ayudan a atender la pulpería en sus tiempos libres. Su esposo y  dos hijos mayores trabajan por aparte, aportan para los gastos del hogar, además Ilva se encarga de cuidar a un niño de 2 años para obtener otros ingresos. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar pan, leche, azúcar, jabón, huevo, arroz, ropa, cosméticos, el cual estima será de ayuda ya que podrá invertir en el inventario de su negocio, comprara variedad de productos para mayor atracción de clientes, que permitirá el incremento de sus ventas generando a la vez mejores ingresos para la familia. Sus planes futuros es ampliar el área del negocio y crecer aun más en productos, su meta próxima es convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea con el objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida tanto económicamente como familiar y  poder ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Ilva, 32, is a humble housewife and merchant; she’s married and is originally from Camoapa-Boaco but currently lives in the city of Managua.  She has owned a grocery store for six years.  She’s the mother of four children two of which are still in her care.  She studied up to fifth grade.  

Ilva started her business selling snacks at the age of 26.  Due to the good demand her products had she later on decided to expand the business and invested in new varied products especially those in most demand from her neighbors.  Today, thanks her effort she’s succeeded in setting up her own grocery store at home. 

This is her first business and her daughters and husband help her tend to the store in their free time.  Her husband and two older children work elsewhere but contribute to household expenses.  In addition, Ilva earns additional income babysitting a 2-year-old child.

She’s asking for the loan to buy bread, milk, sugar, soap, eggs, rice, clothes and cosmetics which she figures will be of help because she’ll be able to invest in her store’s inventory.  She will buy a variety of products to attract the attention of customer that will lead to increased sales and still more growth in products.  Her next goal is to turn the grocery store into a variety store with the objective of improving her living conditions both economically and with respect to her family and to be able to offer her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
Jose, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder mantener trabajo e ingreso para su familia, él está iniciando su trabajo nuevamente la siembra agrícola, para lo cual necesita comprarse fertilizantes y semillas de maíz y frijol, que son los cultivos que realiza, el préstamo es una gran ayuda ya que le permite a través de los fondos prestados poder comprarse lo necesario y realizar su trabajo.
Con el préstamo anterior logró obtener buenos resultados con una cosecha abundante para la alimentación de su familia y para poder generar ingresos a través de las ventas, hasta el momento se mantienen su condición estable y manifiesta no haber presentado ningún inconveniente ni problema de tipo mayor en su familia.
texts.en:
José’s asking for a new loan to continue working and earning family income.  He’s starting a new planting season and needs to buy fertilizer and corn and bean seeds which are the crops he grows.  The loan is of great help because through the funds lent he’s able to buy what he needs and do his work.

He got good results with his previous loan; his harvest was abundant and he was able to feed his family and earn income via his sales.  To date, his conditions remain stable and he states that he’s had no type of major family problem.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Luis Roberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su pareja y sus 3 queridos hijos; él siempre ha sido una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres, por ello lamentablemente no pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día; en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos y noticieros en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Parihuela para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su familia, día a día Luis trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de pescados, él cuenta con un pequeño tricimoto, en el cual todas las mañanas sale a realizar sus ventas por diversas calles; adicionalmente Luis trabaja por las noches como vigilante de un centro educativo de su distrito, él trabaja en su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de de llantas nuevas para su tricimoto; de esta manera Luis contará con un vehículo en mejores condiciones, el cual le servirá de mucho para poder transportarse a lugares más alejados y así espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales desea utilizar para asegurar la educación y bienestar de sus pequeños hijos, ya que sueña con verlos convertirse en buenos profesionales y en hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Luis, 47, lives in the city of Ica in Santiago District with his spouse and three beloved children.  He’s always been a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who puts all his efforts into moving his family forward.  He had to start working to support his parents while still very young which was why he was unfortunately unable to complete his secondary education but he dreams with doing so someday.  In his free time he likes to watch educational and news programs on television and sometimes cooks a delicious “Parihuela” to share with his family.

With much enthusiasm and thanks to support from his family, Luis works day to day in a small fish-selling business.  He has a small three-wheel delivery cart he uses to go out every morning to make his sales throughout the various streets.  In addition, Luis also works as a night watchman at a local school.  He spends about 12 hours daily in his business and feels good doing his work.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help he’s received he will be able to buy new tires for his three-wheeled cart so that he will be able to rely on a vehicle that’s in better conditions that will be of great use to him to transport himself to places that are further away hoping to increase sales and income that he wants to use to insure his young children’s education and wellbeing since he dreams with them becoming good professionals and upstanding citizens.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Yesenia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yesenia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer el negocio,  mejorando la buena atención, se comprara los cosméticos y lociones para poder salir a vender a sus clientes, ya que la mayor variedad de productos le dará una mejor aceptación con los clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, pues  le permitió realizar una buena inversion y crecimientoo en el negocio y apoyar a sus familiares con gastos del hogar, sus hijos se mantienen con salud, el mayor esta con sus estudios de kinder.
texts.en:
Yesenia’s asking for a new loan to strengthen the business improving the good service.  She will buy cosmetics and lotions to go out and sell to her customers since the greater variety of products will make her more welcomed by her customers.

She had a positive effect from the previous loan because it allowed her to make a good investment and to grow in business and to support her family with household expenses.  Her children remain healthy and the oldest is attending Kindergarten.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Hermelinda Del Rosario

texts.es:
Hermelinda, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder realizar la compra de medicinas para la venta, diversificando sus productos entre antibióticos, suplementos alimenticios y vitaminas, y otros productos que sean necesarios para su clientela.

Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior ha logrado aumentar sus utilidades poder mejorar la calidad en los productos, sus clientes están satisfechos y es a través de ellos que ha mantenido una mejor estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is asking for a new loan to buy medicine to resell diversifying her products among antibiotics, dietary supplements, vitamins and other products needed for her customers.

She states that with the previous loan she managed to increase profits to improve the quality of her products. Her customers are satisfied and through them she’s succeeded in maintaining better economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy medicine, vitamins and other natural remedies.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues necesita dinero para poder iniciar cultivo de maíz y frijol, invirtiendo en el abono y en los herbicidas, que son necesarios para aplicarlos ya que le previenen las plagas, además es quiere ayudar para poder a futuro contar con una buena producción de granos básicos.

El préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo ya que  logró realizar la compra de los insumos, loscuales le permitieron tener una cosecha sana de la cual logró generar algunas utilidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Luciano’s asking for a new loan because he needs money to start planting corn and beans.  He will buy manure and herbicide that that need to be applied in order to prevent infestations.  He also wants to help to attain a good harvest of basic grains in the future.  

The previous loan had a positive effect in that he was able to buy supplies that led to a healthy, good harvest that generated some profits for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 28 years old and is a married with two children who are 3 and 5 years old. She purchases and sells drinks like water, juice, local drinks, and Fanta. She has been in this business for three years and she currently employs three people to help her.

Clementine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her pub by buying more drinks like water, juice, local drinks, and Fanta for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, and she will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to expand her pub by buying more drinks like water, juice, local drinks, and Fanta for resale.

loans.name: Askaraly

texts.en: Askaraly is very industrious. He has had his own business for over 10 years. He grows onions, cucumber, and corn. He works hard from early morning till late evening. He sells his harvest to local people. All his customers are glad for his work. He has a large family. His wife does housework and tries to do the best for the family. They have 4 children. Askaraly wants to develop his business so he can improve his living. Askaraly is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers for the land where he works. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Kimpitei

texts.en:
Kimpitei is 47 years old, married, and supports a family of five people. She has been a maize farmer for the last five years earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. With the loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify her business into sheep-raising.

Her future dream is to improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys is 22 years old and is married. Aloys sells various goods such as lotions, sugar, soap, salt, etc. He has five years of experience in this work.

Aloys has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as lotions, sugar, soap, salt, etc., for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as lotions, sugar, soap, salt, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 20 años, es una mujer alegre y con deseos de superación, también es amable y muy cordial.  Es soltera, vive en compañía de sus padres y sus tres hermanos en la casa de sus padres.

Su actividad es la costura y confección de prendas de vestir, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, para luego comprar una máquina de coser con sus ahorros, la cual instaló en su propia casa, donde atiende a sus clientes quienes la buscan por sus buenos acabados. Ha logrando ganarse su aceptación y la recomiendan con otras personas que luego se vuelven sus clientes habituales. Esto lo realiza medio tiempo, ya que en las mañanas trabaja en la atención en una máquina fotocopiadora. Se inició hace más de 4 años, en sociedad con su madre. Le gusta la costura por ser un oficio y ocupación que le brinda los ingresos económicos  que le sirven para apoyar a sus padres a solventar los gastos de su hogar. Pero comenta que lo que le incomoda es el cansancio físico por estar sentada en una misma postura, lo que le ocasiona dolores de espalda, pero eso no la desanima y continua trabajando y esforzándose. Por tanto tiene  planes de ampliar su negocio y comprarse otras máquinas de coser para tener un mejor acabo en su costura y con las ganancias  pagar sus estudios universitarios.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente contenta de contar con un capital de trabajo gracias a esta institución, para así poder entregar los pedidos que tiene pendiente. Además, está a gusto con su banco comunal por ser un grupo unido y colaborador.

Con el monto solicitado, de 800 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de una máquina remalladora valorizada en 380 nuevos soles, con el saldo tiene planeado comprar materiales de costura como telas, hilos y otros en mayor volumen, buscando los precios más bajos.
texts.en:
Patricia is 20 years old, she is a happy, kind and cordial woman who wants to get ahead in life. She is single and lives with her parents and three siblings in their parents’ home.

She works as a seamstress and makes clothing, which she learned from an educational center. With her savings, she was able to later on buy her own sewing machine and installed it on her home where her customers find her and buy her well made products. Patricia has been able to gain her customers’ loyalty and is well recommended to people who later become regular customers. She does her sewing part time since in the mornings she works with a photocopier. She started that job with her mother more than 4 years ago. Patricia enjoys sewing since it is a trade and occupation that allows her to have some earnings that help her support her parents in paying the household expenses. She says that one of the downsides is the physical fatigue from being in one position too long, sitting down, which sometimes gives her a backache but she doesn’t let that get her down so she keeps working hard. At present, she plans to expand her business and buy other sewing machines to have better finishing touches on her work and with her earnings pay for her university education.

This is Patricia’s second loan with MFP and she feels very happy to have work capital thanks to this institution which will allow her to deliver some pending orders. Furthermore, she is happy with her communal bank since she is in a united and helpful group.

With the 800 nuevos soles, Patricia will buy a mending machine that costs 380 nuevos soles; with the remainder she will buy sewing materials like fabrics, threads and other items in greater quantities to get lower prices.

loans.use: buy a mending machine and buy sewing materials like fabrics, threads and other items.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder fortalecer el negocio, pues considera necesaria una nueva inversión en los materiales que le ayudan a mantener el negocio, gaseosas, arroz, quesillo, entre otros productos que son necesarios para poder atender a su clientela en la tienda y pupuseria.

El préstamo anterior le ayudó a fortalecer el negocio y a poderle brindar mejores ganancias, para ayudar a su familia éstos le ha motivado a continuar trabajando de la mano de los préstamos pues considera estar mejorando su condición.
texts.en:
Marta’s asking for a new loan to strengthen the business because she feels that a new investment in supplies like soft-drinks, rice and cheese, among other products is necessary to meet customer demand in her store and ‘pupusa’ [stuffed, grilled corncakes] shop.

The previous loan helped her to strengthen the business and generate higher profits to help her family.  This motivated her to continue working hand-in-hand with the loans because she believes that her condition is improving.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, rice and cheese.

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es:
Rosa, solicita un nuevo préstamo de reinvertir en sus cultivos de maíz y frijol, utilizará los fondos prestados en la compra de abono, herbisidas para aplicarlos al maíz y el frijol al momento de la siembra, está ayudara para poder fortalecer la plantación y prevenirla de cualquier daño que se le pueda llegar, esto le ayudara que a futuro la cosecha sea abundante.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo del cual logró hacer un buen trabajo en la agricultura,pudo mejorar la cosecha, todas sus condiciones familiares se mantiene hasta el momento, no han pasado ningún inconveniente.
texts.en:
Rosa’s requesting a new loan to reinvest in her corn and bean crops.  She will use the borrowed funds to buy manure and herbicide to apply to her bean and corn crops when they are planted which will help to strengthen the plants and prevent any damage that might occur; this will help her future harvest to be abundant.

She had a positive effect from the previous loan which helped her do good agricultural work; she was able to improve the harvest.  All of her family conditions remain stable up to the moment; they’ve not gone through any difficulties.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Silvia Maritza

texts.es:
Silvia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues considera que a través de ellos estará mejorando su negocio, manteniendo la mejor disponibilidad de prendas de vestir para sus clientes, en esta ocasión comprará pantalones para damas, caballeros, blusas y faldas y ropa interior, adquiriendo nuevos estilos y colores para poder ofertar a sus clientes mercadería de calidad.

Ella considera que con el préstamo anterior realizó una buena inversión al negocio, hasta el momento esto le ha permitido mantener su nivel de ganancias para poder ayudar a su familia cubriendo sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Silvia’s asking for a new loan because she believes that through them she will be improving her business by having a better availability of clothes available for her customers.  On this occasion she’ll buy women’s and men’s trousers, blouses, skirts and underwear in new styles and colors to offer quality products to her customers.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family covering her personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 21 years old, married, and supports a family of two people. He has been a maize farmer for the last three years earning a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

He is borrowing his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify his business into sheep-keeping. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is from Cabawan District Tagbilaran City, Bohol, Philippines. She is 38 years old and married with three children ages 7, 14, and 16. Her husband works as a Barangay official and a private driver. Cecilia works in a convenience store located in a hospital within the city and she also cooks and sells snack food like rice cakes, banana cue (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar), and deep fried sweet potatoes. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like bananas, sweet potatoes, and sticky rice, and to pay the tuition fees of her children. It is her dream that her income will enable her to provide for her children's needs and will afford them a good education so that they will be successful someday.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, sweet potatoes, and sticky rice, and to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Jahida

texts.en: This is Jahida, a 39-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married, living with her husband and five school-aged children. She’s cooperating with her husband who has been working at a local company since 2010. As for her, she started her own home business as a tailor in 2004. She’s stylish, fashionable, and seeks to please her customers as much as she can. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new tailoring machine in order to improve her business and increase her productivity. Jahida has big responsibilities to care for and this is the perfect time to develop her work and augment her earnings. She’s planning to open her own tailoring shop and also expand her business outside the country as soon as she can.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, a 47-year-old businesswoman, is married to David, businessman, and they are blessed with three children aged 21, 20 and 15 years. Esther has been operating an embroidery business for the past ten years, earning a monthly income of KES. 20,000 which she uses to support her business.

After being introduced to KADET by an existing customer, Esther is requesting her first loan to purchase a stock of textile materials. With the anticipated extra profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of textile materials.

loans.name: Jose Moises

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo pues tiene la oportunidad de realizar una compra de dos cabezas de ganado (dos vacas), esto le ayudará para aumentar el hato ganadero en sus terrenos y a futuro poder sacar una mejor ganancia por esta compra.

El manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logró realizar un trabajo del cual se ha mantenido hasta el momento y a su familia han logrado mantenerle ingresos estables que puedan cubrir los gastos más necesarios.
texts.en:
José’s asking for a new loan because he has the opportunity of buying two heads of cattle (two cows).  This will help him increase his herd’s size on his land and in future earn better profits on this purchase.

He states that with the previous loan he was able to do work that’s made it possible for him to support himself to date.  He’s been able to maintain stable family income which was able to cover the most necessary expenses.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Kerore

texts.en:
Kerore is 32 years old and married. He supports a family of four children. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last five years with a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

He is borrowing his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, which will facilitate his preparation of the farm and purchase of inputs.

He hopes to use his anticipated profits to expand his farm and re-invest. His future dream is to improve the family's standard of living and educate his children.

loans.use: to prapare the land and buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Ashrafkhon

texts.en:
Ashrafkhon is a very successful business man. He has run his own business for more than 13 years. At first he raised animals, but then he became a butcher. Now, he is one of the best local business men. He sells beef and mutton in his own stall in the market. 

His friends know him as smart, decent and determined. Ashrafkhon has a large family. He must support his wife and his three children with all the modern conveniences. He is asking for a loan to buy cattle for developing his business. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida, the mother of a 13-year-old son who is studying in class 6, has been selling clothes to her community clients for many years. She is knowledgeable about the latest fashion trends, and her clients appreciate the variety of clothes that she sells. Her husband operates a scrap-selling business.

Rashida is now requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to further improve her business. She will buy a larger variety of clothes to sell and is confident the purchase will yield positive results.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard, a 42-year-old businessman, is married to Jane, a businesswoman, and they are blessed with two children. Benard has been running a general shop for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of KES. 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

After being introduced to KADET by an existing customer, Benard is applying for his first loan to purchase more stocks of sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell. With the anticipated profit, he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop that will increase his income and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres es originario de Tomatoyita comarca de Teustepe municipio de Boaco, casado, padre de dos niñas de 9 y 2 años de edad, la niña de 9 años actualmente estudia su segundo grado de primaria. Andres de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol actividad que inicio a la edad de 13 años ayudándole a su papa, luego el se caso, decide independizarse empieza a trabajar en su propio cultivo, hoy en día fruto de su esfuerzo diario además de sus tierras cuenta con sus  propias vaquitas que ha ido comprando con los ingresos que le genera la cosecha, Andres dice que para realizar sus trabajos agrícolas paga mozos ya que el solo no da abasto con el trabajo porque es un trabajo muy pesado. Cuenta con otros ingresos pues también vende cuajadas de la leche que producen sus vacas, sus productos los comercializa en la misma comarca para evitar gastos de transporte.

Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos y pagar  mano de obra para  sembrar frijol y maíz. Andres dice que este crédito  será de ayuda ya que no tendrá que vender sus animales para hacer sus trabajos agrícolas. Su meta próxima es de las ganancias que le genere la cosecha de frijol y maíz  pagar el crédito, con lo que le quede comprarse dos vacas reproductoras para mantener su producción de leche, tener mejores ingresos y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Andrés is from Tomatoyita, Teustepe District, Boaco Municipality.  He’s married and the father of two girls who are 9 and 2 years of age.  The nine-year-old is currently in second grade.

Andrés is a farmer; he grows corn and beans, an activity he started at the age of 13 helping his father.  When he got married he decided to become independent and started working on his own crops.  Today, thanks to his daily effort in addition to his farmland he also owns cows that he’s been buying with profits from his harvests.  Andrés says that in order to do his farm work he hires day laborers because he can’t do all the work by himself because it’s very hard work.  He earns additional income because he sells curd made from the milk his cows produce.  He sells his products in his own district in order to avoid transportation costs.

He’s requesting the loan to buy supplies and to pay labor costs to plant corn and beans.  Andrés says that this loan will be of help because he won’t have to sell his animals in order to do his farm work.  His next goal is to use profits from his corn and bean harvests to repay the loan and to use any money left over to buy two breeding cows to maintain milk production, to earn better income and be able to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farm supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Salman

texts.en: Salman is an adult married man. He’s 59 years old, Lebanese, and living with his wife and five children. Two of his children are still attending school and the three others are working. He’s trying the best he can to support his family and offer them a good way of living. From time to time, his children’s support is considered very necessary, just to be able to cover heavier costs. Salman has been working as a taxi driver for many years. He works on a freelance basis upon requests. Since he wishes to pay his car’s mechanic fees and perform necessary maintenance on it, Salman is asking today to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. This will facilitate his job and allow him to transport his customers safely. In the near future, buying a new van will improve his life financially.

loans.use: to pay his car’s mechanic fees and perform the needed maintenance on it.

loans.name: Saream's Group

texts.en:
Saream is 29 years old and a married father of one baby daughter. The family lives in a rural village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Saream has been rice farming on two hectares for five years to support his family. He is able to earn about KHR10,000 per day. The main challenge for him is the lack of working capital for supporting the business.

Saream’s group consists of three members. He has been with VisionFund for one cycle, while the other members are new clients. The past loan helped him earn a better living. Now he is asking for a new loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, Saream will use his portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds and for plowing. He hopes that his business will become more profitable so as to make his family’s condition better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for farming.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en:
Gulmira is one of the perfect business ladies. For more than six months she has been busy with sewing national dresses. She has her own workshop and works hard. She is a woman of fashion and taste and that is why she sews very beautiful and fashionable dresses. All her clients are glad of her work. Her clients know her as laborious and gentle. Gulmira is not married and lives with her parents. Her parents love her very much. 

Gulmira is going to organize a new business of selling of medicine. She is going to open a pharmacy near her house. Gulmira’s income from her first business is small and she wants to start a new business to improve her living situation. She is asking for a loan to buy goods for organizing the business. Please, help her to organize a new business.

loans.use: To buy medicine to start her new business.

loans.name: Al-Wasim Group

texts.en:
This group is called al-Wasim and consists of four members: Amal, Aisha, Krima and Thabta.  They are ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen.

Amal, 30, is happily married and has three children, all of whom are still in her care. She has always been a hard-working, enthusiastic person who has dedicated all her hard work, together with her husband, to providing for her family. She applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a TV for her house.

loans.use: to buy a TV for her house

loans.name: Al-Akhlag Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Akhlag and consists of four members: Mriam, Aml, Suria, and Amna.  They are ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen.
Mriam is 37 years old. A married woman, she is a mother of seven children.

Mriam is looking to have a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB so she can improve her home living conditions by buying a washing machine.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Maura Maria

texts.es:
Doña Maura de 48 años de edad, es originaria de la isla de Ometepe, actualmente vive en la ciudad de Managua, casada, madre de 3 hijos de los cuales solo el menor esta a su cargo, ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de costura en la comunidad, es dueña de un pequeño taller de costura desde hace 20 años, su nivel académico es hasta tercer grado de primaria. Maura inicio su actividad a los 28 años de edad cuando se caso ya que su suegra se dedica al mismo negocio la cual fue parte de la motivación  de Maura pues al observar el trabajo que realizaba su suegra le fue llamando la atención, decide aprender a coser con el apoyo de su suegra, ella fue obteniendo experiencia y dominio en la costura, luego empieza a vender en los alrededores de la comunidad sus productos, vio que el negocio era rentable entonces decide aumentar su producción para poder cumplir con  los pedidos de cada uno de sus clientes y poder entregar una producción de buena calidad. 
En su negocio la apoya su suegra, sus productos los comercializa en Masaya, Granada, Isla de Ometepe y Rivas aunque a ella le gustaría dar a conocer sus productos en otros departamentos como Matagalpa, Chinandega Y San Carlos para mayor atracción de clientes. Su hijo mayor le envía remesas para que se ayude con los gastos del hogar. Solicita el préstamo para comprar tela, botones, agujas, hilo, encajes, etc, toda la materia prima necesaria para elaborar sus trajes, el cual estima será de ayuda ya que podrá invertir en el inventario de su negocio para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, sus planes futuros  es comprarse dos maquinas de coser para poder  ampliar su producción y complacer a sus clientes, sus meta próxima es hacerle mejora a su vivienda con el objetivo de tener mejores condiciones de vida y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Maura, 48, is originally from the Ometepe Island but currently lives in the city of Managua.  She’s married and the mother of three children; only the youngest one is still in her care.  She provides sewing services in her community.  She’s owned a small sewing workshop for the last 20 years.  Her academic level is third grade.

Maura started her activity at the age of 28 when she got married since her mother-in-law was in the same business and she was part of Maura’s motivation because watching her mother-in-law’s work drew her attention and she decided to start learning sewing to help her mother-in-law out with her work.  She gradually acquired experience and mastered sewing skills.  Subsequently, she started to sell her products around the neighborhood and realized that the business was profitable so she decided to increase production to fill all the orders for each and every one of her customers and to produce good quality products.

Her mother-in-law helps her with the business and she sells her products in Masaya, Granada, Ometepe Island and Rivas although she’d like her products to be known in other departments like Matagalpa, Chinandega and San Carlos to acquire more customers.  Her oldest son sends her stipends to help with household expenses.

She’s asking for the loan to buy fabric, buttons, needles, thread, lace, etc., all the merchandise that’s needed to make her outfits which she figures will be useful because she’ll be able to invest in her business inventory to be able to meet customer demand.  Her future plan is to buy two sewing machines to expand production and please her customers.  Her short-term goal is to do some home improvements in order to have better living conditions and to be able to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de cosecha y siembra de cafe,la socia lo vende en los diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de cosecha y siembra de cafe.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yolanda continues working planting and harvesting coffee.  She sells it in various markets. She works from 8am until 6pm and wants to get ahead through this business.  Her dream is to expand her coffee crops.  She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de manualidades,la socia trabaja trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia hace trabajos como muñecas,manteles y servilletas,por medio de este trbajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las manualidades.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales como tela,pinturas e hilos para que haga las manualidades.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yaneth continues in the manual arts business.  She works from 8am until 7pm making dolls, tablecloths and napkins.  She supports her children through this work.  Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell her crafts.  She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies like fabric, paint and thread to make craft.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy crafts-making supplies.

loans.name: Luis Gualberto

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de seimbra y cosecha de cafe y tambien el socio se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes,el socio tiene una chacra donde seimbra cafe,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de siembra de cafe y negocio de crianza de animales.El socio solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with his business of growing and harvesting coffee.  He also has a business of raising animals like guinea pigs.  He has a farm where he grows coffee.  It is through this business that he wants to get ahead.  

His dream is to expand and improve his coffee growing business and his business of raising animals.

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en: Batbold, 28, lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He started his garment retail business on a rental counter in 2006. His wife helps with his business. He is well known by the local residents. His business is sustainable and has many regular customers and suppliers. Currently, his wife usually runs the garment retail business. He wants to expand his business. Therefore, he has decided to start his new business repairing bicycles. He is a hardworking and humble man. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy some necessary equipment. He is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase necessary equipment for bicycle repair.

loans.use: to purchase necessary equipment for bicycle repair

loans.name: Moy's Group

texts.en:
Moy is a responsible widow and the mother of three children. She is 63 years old and is from a rural village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She works as a rice farmer to support her family, and she has been in this business for 30 years. She supplements her income by making rice wine. The main challenge for her business is the limited water supply for rice farming. She can earn about 21,800KHR from her current business. 

Moy has been with VisionFund for six cycles and has successfully paid back the past loans, while the other members have been with VisionFund for four cycles. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Moy is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, and more rice and raw materials for her rice wine business. She hopes to earn more income so she can live a better life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and raw material for her rice wine business

loans.name: Masek

texts.en:
Masek is 24 years old and married. He supports a family of three children. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last three years with a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

He is borrowing his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. This will facilitate him in preparation of the farm and purchase of inputs.

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and reinvest. His future dreams are to improve the family's standard of living and to educate his children.

loans.use: to pay for preparation of the farm and purchase of inputs.

loans.name: Aimable

texts.en:
Aimable is 29 years old and is married with one child who is 3 years old. Aimable sells various goods such as lotions, soap, biscuits, sugar, etc. He has one year of experience in this work and he currently employs two people to help him. 

Aimable has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as lotions, soap, biscuits, sugar, etc., for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as lotions, soap, biscuits, sugar, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en: Malek is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife, the mother of his only child who is still studying. Like every couple, Malek and his wife wish to offer their child a respectable life, far from problems and difficulties. For this reason, they combine forces to be able to afford heavy life expenses. Malek opened his own butcher shop in 2010. He’s a reputable person who always strives to deliver good and fresh products for his customers. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added cattle for his business. In that way, he will be able to develop his business and augment his sales. In the future, he plans to raise cattle and start his own dairy products trading business as a parallel job.

loans.use: to buy added cattle for his business.

loans.name: Rey's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Rey is 45 years old and married. She is a mother of six children, four of whom (one daughter and three sons) are dependent on her. To make a living, she has been rice farming for nine years, while her husband is a construction worker. The current business earns her about KHR43,300. Her main challenge is the lack of water supply for the rice fields.

Rey has been with VisionFund for three cycles, while the other members have been with VisionFund from one to three cycles. She is leading her group of four female members to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of 500,000KHR to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm and will use part of it for plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income from the business and to earn a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Jesugo 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUGO 6 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom Jacqueline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jacqueline est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Jacqueline n’a pas été à l’école. Jacqueline est mariée à un maçon du nom de Célestin et est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et trois restent à sa charge. Jacqueline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Jacqueline vend depuis dix ans, des condiments à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Jacqueline vend des poissons. Jacqueline s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jacqueline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUGO 6, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Jesugo 6 group has three members, all of whom live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Jacqueline, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 41 years of age and lives in Benin. She did not attend school, is married to a bricklayer called Célestin, and has five children, some of whom are at school and three of whom are still under her care. 

Jacqueline lives with her husband and children and, together, the couple ensures that the family’s various expenses are met. To contribute to these family expenses, Jacqueline has sold seasonings from her home for the past 10 years. As well as this business, she also sells fish. She gets her supplies in the region where she lives. 

To ensure that her customers are satisfied and to increase her sales and income, Jacqueline has requested her first loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Jesugo 6 group.

loans.use: To buy seasoning and fish.

loans.name: Dona 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DONA 3 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies appartenant  un même groupe de tontine. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Léontine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Léontine est âgée de 47 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Léontine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Léontine est mère de sept enfants, dont certains scolarisés et à trois restent à sa charge. Léontine vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule ses différents besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Pour parvenir aux différents besoins de la famille, Léontine vend depuis vingt ans des boules de pâtes (faites à base de l’amidon du maïs) à son domicile et dans sa région. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins ainsi qu’à ceux de ses trois enfants à charge. Léontine s’approvisionne dans sa région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Léontine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DONA 3, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Dona 3 group has three female members, who are all friends and belong to the same savings group. This is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé, in order to increase their business levels. The group’s representative is called Léontine, and she is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. 

Léontine is 47 years of age and no longer lives with her husband. She did not attend school, and has seven children, some of whom are at school and three of whom remain under her care. Léontine lives alone with her children, and is solely responsible for providing for herself and her children. To cover her family’s needs, for the past 20 years she has sold mash balls (made from corn starch) from her home and in her region. This business allows her to easily provide for herself and for the three children who remain in her care. She gets her supplies from her region in Benin. 

To ensure her customers’ satisfaction, and to increase her sales and income, Léontine has requested a third loan from Alidé along with the rest of the Dona 3 group. Their first two loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy corn to make corn mash balls.

loans.name: Maygul

texts.en: Maygul is a very beautiful woman who can cook very tasty foods. She has been busy with this kind of work for more than 18 years. She likes her work very much and always works with pleasure, but her income isn’t enough for building a new house. Maygul has five children and her husband went to a foreign country to find a job. Maygul is the only breadwinner in the family. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials for building a new house. She and her children await your help and support. Please, help them because they need a new house.

loans.use: To buy building materials for building a new house

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old and a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Naphtali who is a business man. They are blessed with two children, ages 5 and 12. Jane has been in the farming business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

Jane is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the lending agency by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

With the anticipated profit from the business she will buy a dairy cow. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into dairy keeping and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Los Inversionistas Exitosos Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal LOS INVERCIONISTAS EXITOSOS; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

La socia Sujay; alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus amistades y familiares, a la vez la socia trabaja de secretaria en una empresa privada de lunes a sábado, la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como colonias para su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican a reparar celulares, elaboración de proyectos, docente, secretaria, técnico de celulares, venta de productos de belleza, restaurador de obras, guía de turismo, proyectista.

La persona que sale adjunto en la foto es un nuevo socio y la persona que aparece con la cara oculta no pertenece al banco comunal.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Sujay belongs to the “Los Inversionistas Exitosos” (Successful Investors) communal bank located in Wanchaq District in Cusco Province and Department.  She alternates her daily activities with the sale of beauty products like creams, perfume and cologne, among others.  She sells from place to place among her friends and family.  She’s also employed as a Secretary in a private firm from Monday through Saturday.  She’s a cheerful, responsible person who very much wants to continue working for her family since this is the way she moves her family forward.   She’s asking for the loan to buy merchandise for her business.

The other group members repair mobile phones, do projects, teach, are secretaries, repair mobile phones, sell beauty products, work in art restoration, are tourist guides and a film projectionist.

The person in the inserted photo is a new member and the person appearing with the blocked out face does not belong to the communal bank.

Sujay is grateful for the loan granted through this means and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza,la socia vende cremas,perfumes y lapiz labiales,la socia trabaja en forma independiente llevando sus productos de belleza a diferentes instituciones,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar perfumes,cremas y lapiz labiales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with her business of selling beauty products.  She sells creams, perfumes, and lipsticks.  She works in an independent way, taking her beauty products to different institutions.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  It is through this business that she wants to get ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy perfumes, creams, and lipsticks.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and lipsticks.

loans.name: Ihsan

texts.en: Ehsan is a 52-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and 3 children. She worked in libraries for many years and after gaining the needed experience, she decided to open her own library in 2010, located in her town. Her husband has worked as a supervisor in a local school since 2001 in order to supplement the family’s income. Today, Ehsan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase books, documents, and all required stationary since her sales rate increases just before the scholarly and academic years begin. This is her first Kiva loan and she hopes to be able to satisfy her clients' demands and get superior financial benefits.

loans.use: to purchase books, documents, and all required stationary.

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is 30 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in her own house, which has electricity but no piped water in Coast Province, Kenya. She has been selling consumer goods in a retail shop for more than four years, earning approximately Ksh 700 per day. Her husband is also a businessman. All of their children are in school and they are working extra hard to ensure that they get a quality education.

Due to insufficient capital, Ashura is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to add stock of maize and wheat flour, rice, and sugar to her shop. In the future, she would like to expand her business, open a wholesale shop, and ensure her children become professionals.

loans.use: to add stock of maize and wheat flour, rice, and sugar to her shop.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia, a merchant, has owned a small grocery store for one year. Her business consists of selling green peas, vegetables, fruits, and cereals. The store is located opposite to her residential house and she sells to people who travel through this area and pass by daily, as well as to her neighbors. Rukia never stops selling and doesn't have any competition, which is why her business is going well. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married and has three adult children.

Rukia needs to invest in the store and came to Yehu to ask for a new loan to stock her store better and meet her high demand. With the loan, she will be able to purchase tomatoes, bananas, potatoes, etc. Thanks to loans from Yehu and Kiva, she has grown her business and improved her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, bananas, potatoes, etc. to better stock her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 70-year-old business lady. She is widowed and has two children. She has been running a retail shop as a primary business and selling cereals as a secondary business for the past six years with a monthly of KES 7,000.

Mary is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to the lending agency by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to purchase dry beans and maize to boost her cereals business. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, she will boost the retail shop business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase dry beans and maize to boost her cereals business

loans.name: Mahoulome 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAHOULOME 2 est composé de quinze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Claudine est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Claudine n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Claudine est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Théophile. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Claudine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Claudine vend depuis cinq ans, des friperies et de l’ananas dans sa région. Claudine s'approvisionne dans sa région  et dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Claudine et les autres membres du groupement MAHOULOME 2 sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The Mahoulome 2 group has 15 members who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Claudine, and she is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. To increase their business levels so that they can better meet their customers’ requests, the members of this group have requested financial support from Alidé for the first time. 

Claudine did not attend school. She is 35 years of age, and is married to a farmer named Théophile. The couple has five children, all at school and all under their care. Claudine and her husband live together with their children, and together they provide for their family. To contribute to the family’s various needs, for the past five years Claudine has sold second-hand clothing and pineapples in her region. She gets her supplies in the region and in a market in Benin.

To increase their business activity and better meet their customers’ requests, Claudine and the other members of the Mahoulome 2 group have requested their first Alidé loan. Their ambition is to increase their business levels.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing and pineapples.

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her blanket-selling business. With the loan, she will buy blankets in larger quantities and different varieties, which will allow her to make more sales and income.

She is a very active lady and performs her household duties very well along with her business. Her family admires her very much due to her helpfulness. Her husband is a factory worker and earns a low income.

Munawar has three children. All of them do different kinds of work to contribute financially to the family. Munawar wants to improve the living conditions of her family, and she is confident that she will be able to do so by improving her business.

loans.use: To buy blankets for resale.

loans.name: Rafikimwema Group

texts.fr:
Liliane  fait partie du groupe Rafikimwema et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 33 ans et est mariée à Bernard, un coiffeur. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés de 2 à 13  ans, dont 3 étudient.

Elle offre le service de charge batterie depuis 4 ans.

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  acheter  un autre moteur  pour charge batterie, le premier est abimé. Elle pourra bien vendre son  service et gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  travailler sans recourir au crédit .En plus, elle voudrait que ses enfants aient un bon avenir, qu’ils aient de la nourrir et qu’ils terminent les études.
texts.en:
Liliane is part of the Rafikimwema group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 33 years of age and is married to Bernard, a hairdresser. Together they have four children aged between 2 and 13, three of whom are at school.

Liliane has provided a battery charging service for four years. This is her third loan with Turame. She plans to use the Kiva loan to buy another motor to charge batteries, as her first one is damaged. She will then be able to sell her services well and earn more money. 

Over the coming years Liliane would like to work without having to take out loans. She would also like to see her children have a good future, have enough food, and be able to complete their education.

loans.use: To buy another motor to charge batteries as the first is damaged, enabling her to sell her services well and earn more money.

loans.name: Assedekon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ASSEDEKON est composé de vingt sept personnes qui résident dans la même agglomération. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Symphorienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Symphorienne est âgée de 47 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Pascal. Le couple a huit enfants dont certains scolarisés et sept restent à leur charge. Symphorienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Symphorienne mène comme activité, la vente de la farine de manioc et de l’huile de palme dans sa région au Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Symphorienne vend des fromages locaux (fabriqués au Bénin). Symphorienne s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Symphorienne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement ASSEDEKON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Assedekon group has 27 members, who all live in the same area. This is the first time that this group has requested financial assistance from Alidé, and they have done so to increase their business levels.

The group’s representative is called Symphorienne, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 47 years of age, and is married to a farmer called Pascal. The couple has eight children, some of whom are at school and seven of whom remain under their care. 

Symphorienne lives together with her children and husband, and the couple ensures that the household expenses are covered. To do so, Symphorienne works selling cassava flour and palm oil in her region in Benin. In addition to this business, she also sells local cheeses (made in Benin). She gets her supplies in a region of Benin. 

To ensure that her customers are satisfied, and to increase her sales and income, Symphorienne has requested a first loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Assedekon group.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour and palm nuts.

loans.name: Edisson

texts.es:
El socio Edisson nació en el departamento de Apurímac pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 48 años de edad y aun no tiene hijos. Su actividad económica principal del socio Edisson es la venta y compra de vehículos nuevos y usados, él vende los vehículos en diferentes provincias del Cusco. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad el socio Edisson requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los carros usados por lo tanto va comprar llantas, pistones y otras cosas más. 

El socio Edisson pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Latina” y le va muy bien pues una persona responsable y puntual.
texts.en:
The communal bank member, Edisson, was born in the department of Apurímac, but now he lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. He is 48 years old and does not have children. His main income generating activity is buying and selling new and used vehicles. He sells them in different provinces of Cusco.
