Le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza dentro de su asociación, pues recibe el apoyo de sus integrantes, quienes velan por el bienestar de cada uno. “En cada reunión siempre aportamos las cuotas con responsabilidad”, afirma.
Eddy invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de dos toros criollos para engordarlos.
texts.en:
Eddy is 34 years old and lives in a house that she inherited from her mother-in-law nine years ago. She resides in the town of Yanamarca with her family, which consists of her husband Raúl and their five children.

Eddy’s husband is in charge of looking after, managing, and selling their crops of potatoes, quinoa, and barley. In the meantime, she is in charge of looking after the animals. She owns bulls, sheep, and pigs. Eddy’s job consists of buying the animals when they are still small or if they are malnourished. After spending time to care for and feed the animals, Eddy is able to see them grow and regain their vitality before they are sold at the market in the city. She has eight years of experience in this type of work. It helps that she has good buyers who always come to her house to see if the animals have matured. “There have been a few opportunities in which buyers will pay for the animals in advance,” she says.

Eddy belongs to the Communal Bank “Corazón de Jesús” (Heart of Jesus) and this will be her fifth loan with MFP. She greatly enjoys working with her association because she receives support from the other members, who are looking out for each other’s welfare. “In each of our meetings, we always support one another in our payments with responsibility,” confirms Eddy.

Her loan will be invested in the purchase of two bulls for fattening.

loans.use: to buy two bulls.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina tiene 27 años, su pareja es Víctor, de 30 años, fruto de ese amor tienen una hija. Juntos viven en su casa propia, la que compraron hace 10 años. Su mayor anhelo es salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

Dina se mantiene sola desde los 21 años, su sueño era tener su propia tienda de abarrotes, pero por cosas del destino se dedicó a la producción y comercialización de ladrillos artesanales. No se arrepiente, ya que le está dando satisfacciones económicas, actualmente los vende en su propia localidad, ya que esa zona está en constante crecimiento económico y poblacional. Normalmente trabaja con su pareja, pero siempre necesitan de colaboradores para que puedan facilitar la producción en un tiempo menor. Su punto de venta es su misma planta de elaboración, y gracias a su trabajo, pudo comprar un carro de carga para que pueda trasladar sus ladrillos hasta su cliente final, con el propósito de minimizar costo y tiempo.

Este es su crédito número 9  con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera puntual y eficiente. Además, se siente satisfecha con su banco comunal, por trabajar con personas que apoyan a sus planes de trabajo. 
Con estos 2,000 nuevos soles invertirá en su ladrillería, comprando materiales para la actividad que realiza.
texts.en:
Dina is 27-years-old and her partner is Víctor, 30; they have a daughter.  They live together in their own house they bought ten years ago.  Her greatest wish is to get ahead and have a better quality of life.

Dina has supported herself since the age of 21. Her dream was to have her own grocery store but due to fate she started manufacturing and selling artisanal bricks.  She does not regret this since it’s produced economic satisfaction for her.  She currently sells them in her own location since the zone is in constant economic and population growth.  She normally works with her partner but always needs helpers to facilitate production is a shorter amount of time.  Her sales point is the factory where they are made and thanks to her work she was able to buy a cargo truck to be able to transport bricks to her customers thus reducing costs and time.

This is her MFP loan #9 so she commits to continue making her payment punctually and efficiently.  In addition, she feels satisfied with her communal bank because she works with people who support her business plan.  She will use these 2000 new soles to invest in her brick factory; she will buy needed raw materials.

loans.use: to buy brick-making raw materials.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo, administra una tienda de productos domésticos y la atiende todos los días, ofreciendo todo tipo de productos que sean necesarios para el consumo diario, vive sólo, entretenido con su negocio y con sus clientes.

Él solicita un préstamo para invertirlo mercadería y poder surtir el negocio en azúcar, frijoles, maíz, pastas, gaseosas jugos, boquitas, dulces, que son necesarias para poder atender a la clientela, este credito le ayudará a permanecer con un buen nivel de inventario y poder atender las necesidades.

La aspiración de él es mejorar cada vez en el negocio, ya que esto le permitirá mantener un buen número de clientes y de la misma manera generar una mejor condición económica para él y sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Alfredo runs a general store, and he works there every day, offering all kinds of basic necessities products needed on a daily basis. He lives alone, pleased with his shop and with his customers.

He is requesting a loan to stock up his shop by investing it in the purchase of sugar, beans, pasta, fizzy drinks, juices, snacks and sweets, products he needs to tend to his customers. This loan will help him keeping a good number or products in his inventory in order to meet his customers’ needs.

His dream is to constantly improve his shop, as this will allow him to have a good number of customers, at the same time providing better economic conditions for himself and his necessities.

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, pasta, fizzy drinks, juices, snacks and sweets.

loans.name: Jose Rudy Agapito

texts.es:
Jose, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para invertir en la compra de tres sacos de fórmula y tres sacos de sulfato, estos son el abono que le ayudara para prevenir el cultivo de las plantas y al mismo tiempo fortalecerlo por cualquier riesgo que pueda ocurrir en el crecimiento, ayudándole a mejorar su producción.

El considera que con el préstamo anterior aumento la productividad de granos básicos en sus cultivos, mejorando para poder comercializar a sus clientes y al mismo tiempo generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: José’s asking for a new loan to buy three sacks of formula and three sacks of sulfate; these are the manure that helps him prevent infestations while strengthening the plants at the same time against any possible risk that might arise during their development helping him to improve production.  He believes that with the previous loan he increased production of his basic grains crops improving in order to sell to his customers while at the same time generating family income.

loans.use: to buy manure and sulfate.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR ANTONIO: se encuentra casado, con 3 hijos
antonio decea poder bardear  y terminar el patio trasero de su vivienda
para poder asi tener su propia privacidad de el i de su familia
al mismo tiempo tener seguridad en su hogar
ya que hoy en día se vive mucha inseguridad
por lo cual antonio decea proteger a su familia asi mismo al patrimonio 
que en un futuro les dejara a sus hijos
asi antonio mejora la calidad de vida de el y de su familia.
texts.en: Antonio is married with 3 children.  Antonio wishes to build a all around his house and finish his back patio in order to provide privacy for his family and at the same time make his house safer.  These days he lives with a great deal of insecurity and because of that Antonio wishes to protect his family and home, which he will someday leave for his children.  This is how Antonio will improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to build a wall around his house.

loans.name: Blanca Jertrudis

texts.es:
Blanca reside con su familia en la ciudad de Ibarra, capital de la provincia de Imbabura, ubicada al norte de la Sierra ecuatoriana. La ciudad cuenta con 181.175 habitantes y es el centro de desarrollo económico del norte del Ecuador. La ciudad tiene una riqueza única de cultura y naturaleza, por lo tanto es una zona turista muy importante del país. La ciudad es conocida por el helado de paila que por su peculiar forma de ser mantienen un sabor a fruta natural que los han hecho famosos alrededor del país. Ibarra también es conocida por un dulce de mora conocido como arrope. El clima de la ciudad es sub tropical con una temperatura que varía de 12°C a 32°C.

A sus 39 años, Blanca está casada con su esposo de 57, vive con sus tres hijos, y lleva adelante un negocio que empezó hace 10 años. Su negocio consiste en vender artesanías pero además vende leche y varios de sus derivados tales como yogurt y queso y es aquí donde desea crecer. Aunque Blanca nunca terminó el colegio, ella ha salido adelante  trabajando 8 horas al día y continuar con labores caseros y cuidando a sus hijos. A pesar de sus largos días y todo su esfuerzo ella sueña con hacer que su negocio crezca y lograr dar una vida más digna a su familia. Por lo tanto, solicita un préstamo a Kiva para poder incrementar la variedad de productos y mejorar la calidad de los mismos, espera comprarlos a mejor precio si realiza esta inversión de esta manera, Blanca podrá tener más ingresos al tener un mayor margen de utilidad,  para brindar un futuro más prometedor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her family in the city of Ibarra, the capital of the province of Imbabura, located in the north of the Ecuadorian Sierra. The population of the city is 181,175 and it is the center of economic development in the north of Ecuador. The city has a unique cultural and natural richness, which makes it a very important tourist zone in Ecuador. The city is known for its helado de paila [fruit sorbet], which has a special natural fruity flavour that has made it famous around the country. Ibarra is also known for a sweet berry dish known as arrope. The city's climate is subtropical with a temperature that varies between 12°C to 32°C.
Blanca, age 39, is married to her husband, age 57, and lives with their three children. She runs a business which she started ten years ago, selling crafts. She also sells milk and various dairy products such as yoghourt and cheese. It is in this area that she wants to expand. Even though Blanca never finished school, she has succeeded by working eight hours a day and keeping up with her housework and caring for her children. Despite the long days and all the hard work, she dreams of making her business grow and achieving a more dignified life for her family. For this purpose, she is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can increase the variety of her products and improve their quality. She hopes to buy them at a better price; if she makes this investment this way, Blanca will be able to have more income and a greater margin of utility in order to offer her children a more promising future.

loans.use: to increase the variety of her products and improve their quality.

loans.name: Herson Enoc

texts.es:
Herson, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder revertir en el negocio, pues iniciará su cultivo de temporada, para lo cual invertirá en la compra de el abono, pesticidas, insecticidas, que son los necesarios para poder prevenirlo de las plagas.

El préstamo anterior le permitió obtener buenas cosechas y mejorar su condición como agricultor, sus circunstancias familiares están cambiando, ya que se encuentra en una situación de mayor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Herson is seeking a new loan in order to be able to invest in his business, since he is about to start his planting for the season.  He will use the funds to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and insecticides, which are necessary in order to prevent infestations.

With the previous loan he was able to obtain good harvests and make improvements to his farm.  His family circumstances are improving, since he is now in a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmem

texts.es:
La socia Maria Del Carmem nació en el departamento del Cusco y vive en la mima ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 44  años de edad y tiene un hijo. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Maria Del Carmem es la venta de útiles escolares y de escritorio, ella tiene una pequeña librería donde vende sus productos y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad la socia Maria Del Carmem requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cuadernos, lapiceros,  mochilas, papeles  y otras cosas más.  

La socia Maria Del Carmem pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Latina” y le va muy bien pues una persona responsable y puntual.
texts.en:
Maria Del Carmem was born in the departament of Cusco and lives in the same city in which she was born.  She is 44 years old and has one son.  Her principal economic activity is the sale of school and writing supplies.  She has a small bookstore where she sells her products, and business is good at her store.

Currently she requires a loan so that she can buy merchandise such as notebooks, pencil cases, backpacks, paper and other items. She belongs to the communal bank “Unión Latina”, and things are going very well for her since she is a responsible and punctual person.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pencil cases, backpacks, paper and other items.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 22 años, es una joven laboriosa, vive con su pareja, Roy, de 23 años. Juntos viven en la casa que los padres de Edith le heredaron. Ambos desean tener un buen futuro con el pasar del tiempo. 
El cultivo de cacao y café es la actividad que realiza diariamente junto a su pareja. Con mucho esmero, han logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus productos sean de muy buena calidad y muy cotizados en los mercados de la su localidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, y lo hace con mucho diligencia, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los secaderos; el secado es la última etapa que realizan antes de llevarlos ha comercializar. 

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, se siente agradecida con las personas quienes le facilitan este préstamo, siendo así, seguirá con su objetivo. Por otro lado, le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal, ya que sus socios son personas quienes apoyan el trabajo de todos.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará un terreno en la que pueda seguir cultivando plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Edith, 22, is a hardworking young woman.  She lives with her partner, Roy, 23, in a house Edith’s parents passed down to her.  They both want to have a better future as time goes by.

The activity she carries out daily with her partner is coffee and cocoa bean growing.  With much dedication she’s managed to make her land more productive which has resulted in very good quality products that are well priced in her local markets.  What she likes best about her work is caring for the crops which she does very diligently.  She’s been in this business two years and considers the most difficult part having to transport the products from her fields to the dryers.  Drying is the last step done prior to taking them to be sold.

This is her third MFP loan and she feels grateful to the people who provide the loan because she’ll be able to continue towards her objective.  On the other hand, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because the members are people who support each other’s work.  She will use the 2000 new soles to buy another parcel of land to continue growing cocoa beans on.

loans.use: to buy a parcel of farmland.

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia is a 60-year-old woman who is married with 13 children. She plans to start a small business, baking.  Sesilia needs a loan to buy flour, sugar,  yeast and dripping oil. She will use her profits to build up her own bakery. 

Sesilia joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, dripping oil, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo pues necesita la compra de concentrados y en la preparación de la milpa,  considera que a través de un préstamo lograra obtener los fertilizantes y el abono, necesario para poder realizar la siembra de esta temporada, así como también compra se harinilla para su ganaderia.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, ya que logró una mayor cosecha para este año y ha logrado tener la comida para el ganado, considera que de alguna manera sus circunstancias familiares están cambiando ya que ha obtenido una mejor suerte en el negocio.
texts.en:
Erlinda is requesting a new loan because she needs to buy concentrated feed and supplies for preparing her field. She believes that a loan will enable her to obtain the fertilizers and compost that she needs for the planting season. In addition, she will buy coarse grain for her livestock.

Her previous loan had a positive effect. She achieved a better harvest this year and was able to provide food for her animals. Erlinda believes her family circumstances are changing somehow, which is why she has had better luck with her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa tiene 37 años, es una mujer muy hacendosa. Está casada con Germán, de 41 años, y fruto de ese amor tienen tres hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un buen futuro. Juntos, viven en la casa que compraron gracias a los esfuerzos que realizan a diario. 

Elisa  y su esposo se dedican a la siembra de cacao. Esta labor la realizan hace 20 años, mejorando cada vez más con el uso de nuevas técnicas de cultivo y trabajando desde muy temprano por la mañana, hasta que cae el sol. Ella es quien lleva a vender su producto a los centros de acopio de su comunidad, mientras Germán toma el trabajo más duro físicamente en el campo. Hasta el momento, están muy contentos con los resultados, por eso han planeado ampliar su terreno de cultivo.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP y se siente muy agradecida, ya que gracias a ello podrá lograr sus objetivos de trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable con las cuotas de su pago, así da ejemplo a sus demás compañeros. 
Con el dinero comprará abono para realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas, ya que espera su próxima cosecha durante el mes de agosto.
texts.en:
Elisa, 37, is a very hardworking woman.  She’s married to Germán, 41, and they have three children she wants to provide a good future for.  They all live together in a house they were able to buy thanks to their daily efforts.

Elisa and her husband grow cocoa beans.  They’ve been in this business 20 years improving more each time with new growing techniques and working from very early in the morning until sunset.  She is in charge of taking their products to sell in their community’s gathering centers while Germán does the more physically demanding field work.  To date, they are very happy with the results which is why they plan to expand their growing fields.

This is her MFP loan #5.  She feels very grateful because thanks to it she’ll be able to reach her work goals.  She is a very responsible member of her communal bank with respect to her payments; she sets an example for all the other members.  She will use the money to buy manure to provide crop maintenance since she’s expecting her next harvest in August.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Jose Herbert

texts.es:
Jose, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo pues considera necesario realizar un ajuste a la moto taxi, pagando el mecánico por el engrase, sistema eléctrico, ya que este es un medio de obtener ingresos a través de la prestación de servicio con los viajes, permitiéndole esta reparación ofrecer a sus clientes un transporte más seguro y cómodo.

Con el préstamo anterior el considera que también le sirvió para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, ha aumentado la clientela y esto le ha permitido tener una fuente permanente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: José’s asking for a new loan because he feels his mototaxi needs service.  He will pay the mechanic to lubricate it and for the electrical system since this is his means of earning an income by providing transportation services.  These repairs will make it possible for him to continue offering safe, comfortable customer service.  He considers that his previous loan was also useful for him to improve customer service.  His clientele has increased which has led to his having a permanent source of family income.

loans.use: to service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
El socio Hipolito nació en el departamento del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 56 años de edad,  es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos. El socio Hipolito es periodista deportivo y tiene un programa de radio de 4:30 pm hasta las 6:30 pm de lunes  a viernes donde comenta noticias deportivos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad el socio Hipolito requiere el préstamo para implementar su trabajo y desea comprar micrófonos, cd y otras cosas más.  Su sueño del Socio Hipolito es abrir un programa deportivo pero en la televisión. 

El socio Hipolito pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Latina” y le va muy bien pues una persona responsable y puntual.
texts.en:
The borrower, Hipolito, was born in Cusco department, and lives in the same city where he was born. He is 56, married, and has four children. Hipolito is a sports journalist and has a radio program from 4:30 pm to 6:30 pm, Monday to Friday, where he comments on sports news. 

He has been in this business for several years now, and it is going well. On this occasion, Hipolito needs the loan to buy equipment for his work, and wishes to buy microphones, CDs and other items. Hipolito's dream is to start a sports program, but on television. 

Hipolito belongs to the “Unión Latina” communal bank, and it is going well, as he is a responsible and punctual person.

loans.use: To buy microphones, CDs and other items.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es casada y tiene dos hijos que estudian en secundaria, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Irpavi en la ciudad de La Paz. 
Ella estudio solo hasta la secundaria y actualmente percibe ingresos de su tienda de abarrotes, trabaja por más de doce horas al día ya que con eso debe cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y servicios básicos de su familia, es por eso que solicita el crédito, ella desea aumentar su capital comprando más productos para ponerlos a la venta  y mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Martha es construir más habitaciones y dar más comodidad a su familia , también ampliar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de  vida..
Es la octava vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Martha’s married and has two children who are attending secondary school.  They all live in her two-bedroom house located in the city of La Paz’s Irpavi zone.  

She only completed secondary school and currently earns income from her grocery store.  She works more than 12 hours daily because she must cover education, food and basic utility costs for her family which is why she’s requesting the loan; she needs to increase capital purchasing more products to sell and improve her income.

Martha’s dream is to add more rooms to increase family comfort and also to enlarge the business to improve income and quality of life.  This is the 8th time she’s worked with IMPRO and second time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 56 years old. She lives in a small village of the Samtredia District with her husband, David, and their 35-year-old daughter. Her daughter is a teacher in the village school and gets a monthly salary. Marina and David run an agricultural business. They have three dairy cows and two calves. They sell approximately 50-70 kg. cheese monthly. They also own a plot of land, where they grow maize. Marina and David work hard on their plot during spring and summer to get a good harvest. They sell the maize on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 550 Lari.

Marina requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and repair the cattle shed. She plans to expand their dairy farm by adding additional cows, but the existing cattle shed doesn’t allow her to implement this plan. After the building is repaired, Marina will be able to keep more cows there. Thus, she will be able to double the production and sales of cheese and the income of the family will significantly increase. Also, Marina will fertilize her agricultural land and will sow more maize. After fertilization and needed agricultural work she hopes to get a larger and better quality harvest. She hopes to sell the harvest for a good price. As a result the family will be able to create better living conditions for themselves.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and repair the cattle shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood, a lathe and an engine for a saw.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola tiene 37 años, su pareja es Isaías, de 41 años; tienen dos hijos: Edú de 18 años y Siomara de 10 años. La casa donde viven es alquilada.
Ella tiene una fuente de soda, donde viene trabajando desde hace 10 años. Prepara jugos de fruta, ensaladas de fruta y diversos tipos de sándwiches. Al principio le fue difícil ganarse la clientela, pero luego que la gente visitó su local ha seguido consumiendo sus deliciosos aperitivos. Hoy disfruta de su trabajo y de los buenos ingresos económicos que le genera. Asegura que el secreto es tener voluntad y ser creativo, vender lo que la competencia no tiene, ser cuidadoso con la limpieza y atender muy bien a la gente. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, comenta que desde que empezó a solicitar este apoyo financiero su negocio va mejorando. Así también, agradece a sus compañeros de banco comunal por recomendarle trabajar de esta manera.
Con estos 1,500 nuevos soles comprará una nueva licuadora y estantes para su fuente de soda.
texts.en:
Fabiola is 37-years-old.  Her partner is Isaías, 41, and they have two children: Edú, 18, and Siomara, 10.  They rent the house they live in.

She has a soda fountain where she’s been working for ten years.  She makes fruit juices, fruit salad and various types of sandwiches.  At first it was difficult to win over customers but once people visited her stand they’ve continued to consume her delicious snacks.  Today she enjoys her work and the good income it generates.  She assures that the secret is having the will and to be creative, to sell what the competition does not have and to be very diligent with respect to cleanliness and to provide very good service.

This is her second MFP loan.  She comments that ever since she started asking for this type of financial support her business has been improving.  She thanks her fellow communal bank members for encouraging her to work this way.  She will use the 1500 new soles to buy a new blender and shelving for her soda fountain.

loans.use: to buy a new blender and shelving.

loans.name: Adolfo Antonio

texts.es: Adolfo Antonio de  32 años de edad de  soltero con un hijo de ocho años, este emprendedor tiene por actividad economica comercio de ganado, tiempo de tener el negocio 8 años, el negocio lo tiene de forma ambulante, el negocio lo inicio y  aprendio de su papa que era ganadero, y con un propio de capital propio , en la actualidad ha crecido su demanda en el mercado ,gracias a su esfuerzo y ganas de superacion personal y la ayuda que leon 2000 y el programa kiva le brinda para ayudarle a superar de vida a los pequeños comerciantes de la zona. El financiamiento lo necesita para imvertir en la compra de ganado para sasfifacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Adolfo Antonio, 32, is single and has an 8-year-old son.  This entrepreneur’s economic activity is being a cattle merchant.  He’s been in business 8 years and does it from place to place.  He started the business having learned from his father who was a cattleman.  He used his own capital.  At present, market demand has increased thanks to his efforts and drive to improve personally and to the help that León 2000 and the Kiva program gives to help small merchants in the zone to improve their lives.  He needs the loan to buy cattle to satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.ru:
Александра продолжает заниматься реализацией женской обуви: зимой торгует туфлями, сапогами и ботинками, летом переходит на шлепки и сланцы. Последний КИВА кредит помог Александре увеличить товарооборот. 
В этот раз Александра планирует вложить кредит КИВА в размере 10 000 гривен в закупку летних сланцев и балеток, которые всегда хорошо расходятся в сезон отпусков и жары в Украине. Цены у Александры всегда умеренные, доступные для среднего класса. Этот товар точно будет ходовым, а балетки также подойдут и для реализации перед школьным сезоном (школа у детей в Украине начинается с 1 сентября).
texts.en: Alexandra continues to sell women's shoes: in the winter time she sells loafers, boots and other winter shoes and in the summer changes to sandals and flats. The previous Kiva loan helped Alexandra increase her sales circulation. This time she plans to invest the loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia to buy summer sandals and ballet flats which are always in high demand during the vacation season in Ukraine. Alexandra's prices are always moderate and affordable for the middle class. This type of merchandise will definitely sell well and the ballet flats will also sell well before the school season which starts on September 1st in the Ukraine.

loans.use: to purchase summer sandals and ballet flats.

loans.name: Dulce Amparito

texts.es:
Dulce es una joven de 23 años de edad, ella vive en la lindad ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se ubica en la selva peruana y posee una flora y fauna impresionante, en una ciudad en la cual uno puede desconectarse del bullicio de la ciudad y apreciar lo maravilloso de la naturaleza ya que sus paisajes son lindísimos. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear ya que la ayuda a despejarse del cansancio propio del trabajo, también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Ceviche. 

Con mucho entusiasmo Dulce trabaja como vendedora en un negocio de venta de bicicletas, ella trabaja alrededor e 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; ella cree que el va viene en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y siempre atiende a sus clientes de manera amable.

Dulce está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para poder iniciar su negocio de bodega (venta de abarrotes y productos de primer necesidad),con lo cual comprara mercaderia como arroz, azucar, fideos, conservas, golosinas, entre otros, con lo cual tendrá un ingresos mas y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y apoyar con los gastos de su hogar, así ella podrá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Dulce, 23, is a young woman living in the delightful city of Pucallpa, a city noted for its warm, welcoming climate.  It’s located in the Peruvian jungle and has an impressive flora and fauna.   It’s a city where one can disconnect from the noise of the city and appreciate the beauty of nature since its scenery is very beautiful.  When she has any free time available she very much likes to go out for walks that help her get rid of the tiredness caused by work.  She also enjoys eating one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Ceviche.”

With much enthusiasm, Dulce works as a salesperson in a business that sells bicycles.  She works about 8 hours daily and can tend to up to 20 customers daily.  She believes she does well in her work because she’s very responsible and always takes care of customers kindly.

Dulce is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy merchandise to open a grocery store (sale of groceries and basic staple items).  She will buy rice, sugar, noodles, conserves and snacks, among other with which she’ll have an additional source of income and will be able to improve her quality of life and help with household expenses.  In this way she will be able to continue striving towards making her greatest dream a reality: to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika y su esposo forman un joven matrimonio, aun no tienen hijos, porque quieren primero comprar su casa donde ellos puedan vivir en la tranquilidad de un hogar seguro. Ella trabaja para una empresa de sorteos y su esposo es asistente en una oficina, desean mejorar su calidad de vida y tener un patrimonio para  propio para ya no seguir pagando renta y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Erika and her husband are a young newlywed couple. They have no children because they first want to buy a house where they can live peacefully and establish a secure home. She works for a lottery company while her husband is an office assistant. They want to improve their quality of life and have an asset of their own.

Erika and her husband no longer want to continue paying rent so that they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to make a down payment toward the purchase of a home.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer el negocio con más capital de trabajo, comparándose pintura, lijas, hierro, entre otros que son necesarios para trabajar en estructuras metálicas elaborando puertas y balcones, este crédito le ayudara a darle continuidad a su negocio y a continuar también prestando un buen servicio.

El préstamo anterior le ayudó a fortalecer el taller con los materiales necesarios, esto mismo le produjo unas mejores ganancias para su familia y cubrir sus gastos cotidianos.
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a new loan in order to bolster his business with more working capital. He'll purchase paint, sandpaper, iron and other items he needs for working with metal structures and manufacturing doors and balconies. This loan will help him to keep his business going and also to continue providing a good service.
The previous loan helped him to strengthen his shop with the materials he needed. This resulted in higher earnings for his family and for covering his daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase paint, sandpaper and iron.

loans.name: José Epigmenio

texts.es:
Don José tiene 47 años de edad, tiene cinco hijos. Desde hace más de 25 años se dedica a realizar trabajos agrícolas, como a la siembra de maíz y fríjol. Además, él recibió una capacitación sobre el manejo de ganado lechero, el cual esta poniendo en práctica. Pues desde muy pequeño ha trabajado muy fuerte junto con sus padres en la agricultura y la ganadería en pequeña escala.

Los insumos agrícolas y los fertilizantes los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a cuarenta y cinco minutos en transporte urbano y es la ciudad que esta más cerca. Don José solicita el préstamo para comprar ganado de repasto, engordarlo y posteriormente venderlo. Puesto que quiere, poner en práctica sus conocimientos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida. Él desea brindarles el estudio a sus hijos, comprar más ganado para estar en el negocio de una forma más constante.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old and he has five children. He has been working as a farmer planting corn and beans for more than 25 years. On top of this, he has attended a seminar on breeding dairy cows, something he is currently putting into practice. He has been working very hard with his parents since he was very young both in agriculture and in small scale livestock breeding.

He buys farming supplies and fertilizers in a town located at forty-five minutes by bus from where he lives, and this is the closest town to his place. José is requesting a loan to buy non-dairy cattle to fatten it and then sell it. He wants to put his knowledge into practice and improve his income to be able to improve his standard of living. He wants to provide his children with an education and to buy more livestock in order to run his activity in a more constant way.

loans.use: To buy non-dairy cattle.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto es un joven muy trabajador, vive en el distrito de Parcona, distrito que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y la ganadería. Roberto en sus tiempos libres le gusta mucho ver televisión, en especial programas de comedia, en ocasiones también le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual son los riquísimos Tallarines Rojos. 

Con ese carisma que la caracteriza Roberto trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos para bebes, como corralitos, andadores, entre otros, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 30 clientes diariamente; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo tiene mucha paciencia con los papas y mamas que van a su tienda, sobre todo cuando son padres primerizos.

Roberto está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como bicicletas, zancudos, tinas de baño, entre otros. Así de esta manera podrá tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, así el podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una cadenas de tiendas”.
texts.en: Roberto is a very hardworking young man. He lives in the district of Parcona, which is characterized by its warm and friendly atmosphere; it is also known for its farming and livestock. in his free time he loves to watch television, especially comedies. One of his favorite dishes to eat is a local dish known as Tallarines Rojos (Red Noodles). With his characteristic charisma, Roberto runs his small business selling products for babies, such as play pens, walkers and other items. He works around 10 hours each day and can serve around 30 customers per day. He believes that his business is going well because he is very friendly to his customers and above all has a lot of patience with the mothers and fathers who come to his shop, especially those who are first-time parents. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help he will be able to buy merchandise for his shop such as bicycles, bathtubs, strollers and other items. This will enable him to offer a greater variety of products to his clients and increase his income. He will continue to fight to make his dream a reality: "to have a chain of stores."

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his shop such as bicycles, bathtubs, strollers and other items.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 45 años, su esposo hace 7 años es Marco, con quien tienen tres hijos: Celeste, Valeria y Matías. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en la localidad de Ataura.  
Hace 2 meses comenzó con una tienda de comestibles en la vivienda de su padre. Allí vende todo tipo de verduras, bebidas, panes y demás alimentos. Hace 8 años tenía una tienda que tuvo que cerrar por falta de capital. Ahora trabaja con más ahínco, todos los días, pues está teniendo mucho éxito. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y gallinas, ya tiene 70 ejemplares, y con la venta de es éstos, paga los estudios de sus hijos. “Ahorro dinero, sembrando los pastos que comen, para no gastar en su alimentación”, comenta. Así también, los fines de semana aprovecha la acogida de su tienda para vender hamburguesas y papas fritas. Espera consolidar su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo amanecer” y este es su cuarto crédito con MFP. Le gusta trabajar en su grupo, pues las personas que lo conforman son responsables y siempre se apoyan entre ellas en cada reunión. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en sus cuotas.
María invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad (azúcar, arroz, fideos, leche, etc.) para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old. Her husband of seven years is Marco and they have three children: Celeste, Valeria, and Matías. She owns her home, which is located in the town of Ataura.

Two months ago, María opened a grocery store at her father’s house. There she sells all types of vegetables, beverages, breads, and other food products. She had a store eight years ago, but she was forced to close it due to a lack of capital. Now she works harder each day and has had great success. In addition, she raises guinea pigs and chickens. María currently has 70 animals that she will sell in order to pay for her children’s studies. “I save money by growing the food that the animals will eat, so I don’t have to pay for that expense,” she says. On the weekends, she takes advantage of the reception her store has gained by selling hamburgers and French fries. She hopes to consolidate her business and improve her earnings.

María belongs to the Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) and this is her fourth loan with MFP. She enjoys working with her group because the members are responsible and always support one another at each meeting. For this reason, María promises to be punctual with her payments. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of basic necessities such as sugar, rice, noodles, milk, and other items so that she can restock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, noodles, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 47 years old and married.  She lives in a small village of the Abasha District with her husband Nodar and their two children (19 and 23 years old). Their 19-year-old daughter is unemployed; their son works on construction and gets wages for his work. 

Manana and Nodar are busy with their agricultural business. They have three milk cows, and they produce cheese. They sell about 40 kg. on the local open market. They also have a plot of land, where they grow nuts.  They sell about 100 kg. of nuts seasonally. In addition to the agricultural business, they are busy with trading. They have a grocery store at home. The family's average monthly income is 650 Lari.

Manana requested a loan to buy more stock for the store. She will diversify the products, attracting new customers and increasing sales. With this loan,  the family's income will increase. With increased income, they hope to purchase a car. Taking into consideration all the above, the family's living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy food and soft drinks. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more food and more kinds of soft drinks for her cafe.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan would like to take a further loan to buy more materials for her production of iron braces. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in further increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She hopes she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more materials for her production of iron braces.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly would like to take a further loan to buy more and better materials to increase her production of shoes. 

Ly's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in further increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She hopes that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy better quality materials to increase her production of shoes.

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is 29 years old and married, with one child.   He operates a matatu, a minivan seating about a dozen passengers.  He has been in this business for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the money for fueling and maintaining his vehicle. He plans to save the anticipated profit until he gets enough money to purchase another matatu.

In the future, he hopes to own a fleet of matatus and provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy fuel for his minivan and maintain it.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is 52 years old and single.  She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.  Anh has been running a game store in the front of her house for ten years. She started this business to cover her living expenses. 

Anh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more games and equipment to better satify her customers. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers, and she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more games and equipment to satify her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her rentals, branding and hire a teller

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a regular client of Yehu Microfinance; she trusts us a lot. Saumu lives in Samburu in her own home with her husband.

Saumu has had a food shop since last year. Her business is well-established and she and her husband run it. She has taken out and repaid over 1 loan from Yehu.

She tells us that she has built up a good customer base throughout the year, and they always shop at her store. She would like to be able to stock her store more, so she is requesting a loan for the purchase of food to stock her business; drinks, baked goods, and more.

loans.use: to purchase food to stock her business; drinks, baked goods, and more.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 28-year-old man from Kisumu city who is married to Lydia. They have one child who is five years old.

Benson operates a tree and flower seedling business, which he has operated for the last five years.  With this vast experience, he makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. He is a member of KADET LTD and he is requesting his third loan of 50,000 KES, with which he plans to purchase more seedlings for farming.

He will use the anticipated profits to increase his stock.  Benson dreams of becoming a supplier of seedlings in the Kisumu region.

loans.use: To buy more seedlings

loans.name: Otgontugs

texts.en: Otgontugs, 30, lives with his wife in an old small house in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. He has been running his shoe production business since 2008. He makes buryad shoes and art shoes. He is well known to the customers and they always appreciate his shoes as quality. Thus, his business has had many regular customers such as art college students and art organization staffs. In this summer, Otgontugs plans to repair his old workplace in order to live and work in a comfortable environment. He is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to buy the necessary building materials to repair his workplace.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his workplace

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is 33 years old and comes from Gaza. She is married and has five girls, three of whom go to school.

Sabreen has owned a beauty salon for three years and has one employee who helps her.

She asked Ryada for this loan to buy an electricity generator, air conditioner, and new decorations for the salon

Her wish is to have her work increase and more customers arrive in order to help her husband improve their income and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a generator, air conditioner, and new decorations for her salon

loans.name: Dani

texts.en:
Dani is a Serbian man living in the Serbian ethnic community of Kosovo. He is married and has three children. The oldest is seven years old and youngest two years old. Dani works as a butcher. His job is the family’s main source of income. He has been in his business for a long time and he doesn’t earn enough to support the needs of his family.

Two years ago he started to build a house. The money he generates through his business is not enough to finish the house.

The loan Dani is requesting is to buy construction materials to finish a house. 

His goal is to finish a house, to have a bigger space and offer better security for his family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en: Munhbayar, 42, lives with her husband and her three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Baganuur district, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her elder two daughters are secondary school students. She has been running her retail garment business since 2003. She is well known by the local residents. Her business is sustainable and she has many regular customers and suppliers. The income she generates from her business is not sufficient to provide for her family. She wants to expand her business. She is a hardworking, open-minded and humble woman. She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more garments to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more garments to sell.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong would like to take a second loan to buy food and fruit to make fruit juice to sell at her stall. Hong's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of food and fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Charity Araba

texts.en:
Charity is a 32-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 10, two of whom go to school. 

Charity runs a food store and has been in business for three years. She has no employee. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase tomatoes, onions, and many other items  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Charity would like to expand her business. Her major challenge includes high transportation costs.

Charity says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan .

loans.use: to buy more items like tomatoes, onions, etc

loans.name: Suleman

texts.en:
Suleman is a married man with four lovely children between the ages of seven years and seven months. He is 28 years old, and lives in his own house though it does not have electricity or piped water. Suleman tells us that he was introduced to Yehu by a friend and has tasted the good products it offers to its clients.
He has been operating a video hall for some time and he now wants to open a new business of selling clothes. His aim is to have a diversity of businesses so as to increase profits and improve his living standards.
He intends to use the loan to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. He hopes to repay his loan on time and apply for more loans to fully invest in the business and become a famous entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa would like to take a second loan to buy noodles, meat and other ingredients to make Thai soup to sell at his stall. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase sales. He also hopes that the loan he can help him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of food to meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 59, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire.

Anh has been running a food stall for 19 years. She sells food for breakfast to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more good quality food to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more good quality food to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong would like to take a second loan to buy materials for his machine shop. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy equipment and materials for his machine shop.

loans.name: Xuong

texts.en: Xuong is requesting a new loan to buy incense and worship products to sell at her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods to stock her store.

loans.name: Erdenesaihan

texts.en: Erdenesaihan, 28, lives with his mother and younger brother in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Tosontsengel, Mongolia. He started his building repair business with his younger brother in 2008. In the winter, he tends some local herders' livestocks. The income he generates from his business is not sufficient to provide for his family. He wants to increase his business income. Therefore, he needs to purchase some tools in order to increase his business income as well as improve his profit. Also, his younger brother is planning to marry. So he needs to buy a ger to give his brother. He is a diligent and humble man. He is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy a ger to give his brother.

loans.use: To buy a ger to give to his brother.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh would like to take another loan to continue her current business of repairing and selling air conditioners. With her loans, she would like to buy more old air-conditioners to repair and sell to her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy old air-conditioners to repair and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Le is requesting a new loan to buy a range of softdrinks and fruit juices to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, increasing sales, and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and fruit juices to sell.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu would like to take a further loan to buy toys and confectionery to sell from her stall. Thu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy toys and confectionery to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 49 years old, and is married with a son. Her husband supports the family by working as a mechanic. She has been running a tailor shop at her house to make clothes for her customers for six years. She started this business to cover her expenses. She lives with her husband and her son in Ho Chi Minh City.

Thuy is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more kinds of fabric and better sewing materials. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business. 

She also hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fabric and better sewing materials.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is a 42-year-old married woman. She lives with two daughters, one son and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For ten years, she and her husband have run a tailor shop to make garments and other products to sell for their customers.

Hang would like a loan to purchase better quality fabric and materials at competitive prices from wholesalers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase better quality fabric and materials at competitive prices from wholesalers.

loans.name: Sambuu

texts.en: Sambuu, aged 47, lives in an apartment with his wife and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar city. His wife works at a secondary school as a primary class teacher. His son is a college student. Sambuu was a gold beater for 10 years. Now he is running a lock solving service. He carries out this business on a call-out basis. Therefore he needs a hybrid car because he travels dozens of kilometers throughout the city to provide the service. He requires 5,000,000 MNT loan to buy a hybrid car. He thinks that he will pass on his business to his second son, as he learns the service skills.

loans.use: To buy a hybrid car

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga would like to take a further loan to buy cosmetics and other supplies and materials for her beauty salon. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and other materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa would like to take a further loan to increase her sales by buying more kinds of rice to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para poderlo invertir en el negocio manteniendo su venta de tortillas y también el taller de costura, se comprará leña, maiz y gas, para el negocio de las tortillas y se comprará materiales de costura para elaborar prendas de vestir en la sastrería, este crédito le brindará  los recursos económicos para que ella puede invertir en el mejor funcionamiento del negocio.

Con el préstamo anterior logró fortalecer el negocio del cual se ha mantenido junto a su familia en esta temporada, considera que a través de estos préstamos están mejorando su capacidad de respuesta a los clientes y sus condiciones familiares.
texts.en:
Karla is requesting a new loan for her tortilla sales and sewing workshop businesses.  She will buy firewood, corn and gas for the tortilla business, and sewing materials to make clothing in her tailor shop.  This loan will give her economic resources so that she can invest in the better functioning of her businesses.

She used the last loan to solidify her business which has supported her family in this season.  She thinks that through these loans her ability to fill her customers needs and her family living conditions are being met.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, gas and sewing materials

loans.name: Tsul-Erdene

texts.en: Tsul-Erdene is 27 years old, and lives with his parents aged 66 and 62, who are retired at the moment. They live in a private house in a ger district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Tsul-Erdene is not married. He started a construction and decoration business and a taxi service business in 2007 and is still running them. The ger district is not connected with social heating systems in Ulaanbaatar city, where the cold weather reaches minus 40 degrees at its peak. To fight the coldest weather, Tsul-Erdene is planning to purchase a gas-stove to heat the house and provide better living conditions. He is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan for this. His parents say about their son: "Our son is a honest and responsible person ... we always support him with our hearts."

loans.use: To purchase a gas-stove to heat the house and provide better living conditions

loans.name: Metiyo Kweji

texts.en:
Metiyo is a 45-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 5 children between the ages of 10 and 22. All of them go to school. 

Metiyo runs a general store, and has been in business for 6 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotion by its officers. He is taking a loan of 1500sdg to purchase soda, Red Bull and many other items. Metiyo has no other source of income apart from this business.

In 5 years Matiyo would like to expand his business and open other branches.
His major challenges include high transportation costs.

Metiyo says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan .

loans.use: to buy more items like soda, Red Bull, bread etc

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 50 years old. He is married and lives in the small village of Abasha District with his family: his wife Dali, 28-year-old son, daughter-in-law and a mother who is a pensioner. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They have three milking cows and a calf. Gela and Dali produce cheese and sell approximately 50-60 kg. cheese monthly. They own a plot of land where nuts are grown. They pick nuts in late summer and sell them in nearby villages. Along with the family business, Gela and his son work on construction and get a service fee for the work.

Gela requested a loan to purchase a mini tractor. He will cultivate the land owned by the family. He will sow various vegetable there. After properly done seasonal work, he hopes to get a good quality harvest, which will be sold for a good price.  Also, Gela will use the tractor to provide seasonal agricultural services to local farmers and will get a`service fee for the work. This will significantly increase the income of the family. With the increased income he plans to purchase a car. Taking into account the above-mentioned activities, the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a mini tractor

loans.name: Bay

texts.en: Bay is requesting a new loan to buy good quality food and ingredients for her store. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of food to sell from her noodle stall.

loans.name: Marcela Maribel

texts.es:
Marcela, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita comprarse más materiales para su tienda aumentando la variedad por esto comprará arroz, frijoles, azúcar, productos lácteos, entre otros que sean necesarios para atender la demanda de su clientela, buscando siempre el mejoramiento del negocio.

Su efecto con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, pues le permitió mejorar la variedad de productos y mantener la fidelidad de sus clientes, hasta el momento sus ventas han aumentado y sus clientes, también en su familia sus circunstancias se han mantenido estables.
texts.en:
Marcela is asking for a new loan because she needs to buy more items to increase the variety in her shop. For this reason she will buy, amongst other things, rice, beans, sugar, dairy products which she needs to meet the demand of her customers, endeavouring to always continue to improve her business. 

Her last loan had a positive impact, as it allowed her to improve the variety of products and maintain the loyalty of her customers. Now her sales and her customer-base have increased, and her family's situation has remained stable.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar and dairy products.

loans.name: Aibek

texts.en: Aibek is 27 years old and lives with his wife in Bayan-Ulgii province in Mongolia. He also feeds his mother and younger sister. His mother earns a little income, but his wife and younger sister are unemployed. He started his own taxi service business after his long-term job search. At the same time, he earns a profit from selling truck parts, which were collected from the countryside. Today, Aibek has exprience in the transportation service business in his town and the local residents appreciate him as a diligent man. Aibek is planning to expand his business and to support his younger sister to start-up her own business. Currently, Aibek is requesting 3,080,000 MNT to buy truck parts to start his sister's business.

loans.use: To buy truck parts to start his sister's business

loans.name: Dushiko

texts.en:
Dushiko is 49 years old. He lives in a small village of Vani District with his wife Khatuna and their three children (9, 13 and 17 years old). All three, study in the village school. Dushiko is a Director in his village school and Khatuna is a teacher. They receive monthly salaries. In addition to their activities, they are busy with the family agricultural business. They have 2 milking cows and 2 calves. Khatuna milks cows twice a day and produces cheese. They have a pig and sell piglets in nearby villages. In addition to their livestock, they are busy with farming. They own a plot of land, where nuts is grown, and a vineyard. In the fall, they pick grapes and produce wine. Dushiko and Khatuna sell the produced cheese, wine and nuts on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Lari.  They work hard but still don’t have enough income to put away some savings for purchasing additional needed household goods or for renovation of the house.

Dushiko plans to open a grocery store in his village. He requested a loan for the store. He has his own building so he will need to repair it and will purchase refrigerators and other necessary equipment for the store. After the store is equipped, he will purchase inventory. There is no similar store in the neighborhood and Dushiko hopes that he will attract customers and will have good sales. Thus, Dushiko will start a new business in order to increase the income of the family. With the increased income, they plan to renovate the house and purchase household techniques. As a result, Dushiko and Khatuna will be able to create better living conditions for their three children. They hope for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to open a grocery store

loans.name: Saoudatou

texts.fr: Epouse d’un revendeur et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 à l’école, Madame Saoudatou est âgée de 32ans. En 2008, elle a démarré son activité de vente de friperie. Activité qu’elle exerce dans un marché de la place avec sa fille ainée. Son approvisionnement se fait au même lieu et elle sollicite ce premier prêt de WAGES pour renforcer sa vente d’habits de friperies. Elle veut faire développer son activité et assurer le bien – être de la famille.
texts.en: The wife of a retailer and a mother of four children in school, Ms. Saoudatou is 32 years old. In 2008, she started her business selling secondhand clothing. With her oldest daughter, she operates it at a local market. Her supplies are gotten from the same place, and she is requesting this initial WAGES loan to bolster her sales of used clothing. She wants to develop her business and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Nandinsoyol-Erdene

texts.en: Nandinsoyol-Erdene is 34 years old and lives with her husband, Oyunbaatar, and two children in a ger in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her daughter goes to secondary school and her two-year-old son stays at home. She started her organic dairy production business in 2009 with 5 dairy cows. She sells the organic milk to local residents. Her business seems to be sustainable because she has gained a number of regular customers. She is a good-natured woman, who says "I want to buy two more cows to improve the breeding and increase the production volume." She needs 2,000,000 MNT to purchase good breeding cows.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 48 years old. He lives in a small village of Abasha District with his family: his wife Eka, his 5-year-old daughter and his parents, who are pensioners. His wife is a refugee and receives assistance from the local government. 

The family is busy with their agricultural business. In particular, they work with livestock. They have six milking cows and two piglets. David and Eka produce cheese, part of which is used by the family with the rest sold at the local open market. The family's total average monthly income is 550 Lari.

David requested a loan for purchasing milking cows; he wants to expand his dairy farm. With more cows he will be able to increase production and cheese sales. This will positively impact the family income. Increased income will be reinvested in the family agricultural business to expand and become more profitable, which will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Sansarmaa

texts.en: Sansarmaa is 31 years old and lives with her husband and son in the Suhbaatar district, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband works for a private company and the son goes to kindergarden. She used to work as a teacher at the 58th secondary school. Currently, she is conducting a training center for pre-school aged children, and the monthly income is around 735,000 MNT. She has obtained loans ranging from 1,500,000-3,000,000 MNT and has been paying her debt on time. Her business is expected to be improved in the future. She is a good-hearted woman and says "I wish that all children be well-educated and enlightened." She is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a hybrid car to carry children to the training center.

loans.use: To purchase a hybrid car to carry children to the training center

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Revendeuse de cartes de recharges depuis 2008 de façon ambulante, Madame Adjo est âgée de 26ans et a 01 enfant en charge. Elle est à son premier crédit de WAGES et ce montant qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle désire élargir son activité en ayant une boutique. Avec le profit  réalisé, elle veut pouvoir assurer l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en: Mrs. Adjo is a street vendor selling prepaid cell phone cards. She is 26 years old and has one child in her care. She is on her first loan with WAGES. This loan will allow her to stock up in order to better meet customer demand. She would like to expand her business and open a store some day. THanks to her revenues, she would like to be able to provide for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy prepaid cell phone cards.

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is a hardworking man. He is taking out a loan of Ksh 20,000 to start another business. With this current loan, he plans to purchase timber for resale. 

Kazunga lives in Kaloleni with his family. His business goal is to expand his businesses and open more businesses, while his personal goal is to see his children educated.

Kazungu is so grateful to both Kiva and Yehu for the support given. Thanks for the previous loan that improved his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase timber for resale.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marilyn used her last loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Now, she is facing a need again in her agricultural business where she cultivates fruits. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Abesalom

texts.en:
Abesalom is 65 year old; he lives in a small village of Samtredia District with his family, wife Izolda, son, daughter-in-law and 3-year-old granddaughter. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They have one milking cow and produce approximately 20kg. of cheese monthly. They also have a plot of land, where tomato, greens, and nuts are grown. They work hard on their plot to get a good harvest. They sell the harvested products on the local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 400 Lari. which is hardly enough even for food for 5 members of the family. 

Abesalom requested a loan to expand his agricultural business. He will purchase construction materials for the greenhouse. He plans to expand and renovate it. When the greenhouse is ready, the family will sow more vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage and greens) throughout the entire year. This will increase the sales and monthly income of the family. With the increased income, they will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable. As a result, living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to expand and renovate the greenhouse

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en: Annastasia is 28 years old. She is married, with two children, a two-year-old son who is in school, and a seven-month-old daughter. Her business is selling clothes in a small shop and she has done this for three years. She began this business out of the necessity to have a source of employment in order to have a profitable livelihood to support her children. Now, Annastasia aspires to accomplish her dreams and personal goals, such as finishing the construction of her home and opening a boutique. The financing that she is applying for will be invested in the purchase of bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been operating a poultry business. She is 34 years old, married to a carpenter, and has been blessed with four children.

Margaret is a business-oriented woman, who dreams of making bigger profits in order to establish a new business which will help her in improving their financial stability. She has had this business for almost two years and it has allowed her to help her husband to satisfy their basic needs and save for the education of her four children.

In order to attain her goal, she is requesting additional working capital of Ksh 20,000 which will be used to buy feeds and chicks. She believes that her faith and dedication in running her business will make it possible for her to achieve success in life. Despite the good progress, she tells us that her major challenge is disease outbreak.

loans.use: to buy feeds and chicks.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Madame Yawa est veuve. Elle a 02 enfants qui sont âgées de 37 et 35ans. Depuis 2006, pour subvenir aux dépenses de la famille, elle vend plats jetables, des papiers torchons et des sandalettes dans un marché de la place. Sa difficulté est la concurrence croissante sur le terrain. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et ce prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle veut renforcer son activité et assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Yawa is a widow. She has two children who are 37 and 35 years old. She has been selling disposable plates, paper towels, and sandals at the local market since 2006 in order to meet her family's needs. Her main difficulty is competition within the market. She is on her second loan with WAGES which allows her to purchase merchandise. She would like to strengthen the business and ensure the self-sufficiency of her family's dietary needs.

loans.use: to purchase disposable plates, rags and toilet paper.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Agée de 44ans et mère d’01 enfant âgé de 12ans qui est scolarisé, Madame Abra est une femme dynamique qui se bat chaque fois pour joindre les deux bouts afin de prendre soin de sa famille. Depuis 2009, elle a commencé par vendre des produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et la difficulté qu’elle rencontre est le ralentissement dans les achats.  Elle est à son premier crédit de WAGES et cela lui servira à s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle veut avec les profits supplémentaires acheter des cartes de recharges et des produits d’alimentation générale. A l’avenir, elle veut devenir grossiste et voir son enfant s’épanouir.
texts.en: A 44-year-old mother of one 12-year-old child who attends school, Ms. Abra is a dynamic woman who struggles every time to make ends meet in order to take care of her family. Since 2009, she has been selling general food products at a shop. She gets her supplies in Lomé and the difficulty she faces is the slowing down of purchases. She is on her first loan from WAGES and this will serve to obtain supplies of her merchandise. With her supplemental profits, she wants to buy rechargeable phone cards and general food items. In the future, she wants to become a wholesaler and see her child flourish.

loans.use: To buy general food products.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Madame yawa est mère d’01 enfant âgé de 09ans qui va à l’école. Son mari est magasinier dans une société de la place. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et maitrise bien son domaine. En plus de sa coiffure, elle vend des mèches pour bien répondre aux besoins de ses nombreux clients. C’est depuis 2002 qu’elle exerce l’activité et elle s’y plait bien. Une personne l’aide. Elle sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter des mèches. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, devenir grossiste et participer à l’éducation de son fils.
texts.en: Ms. Yawa is the mother of one child, who is 9 and attends school. Her husband is a stock controller at a local company. She is a hairstylist by profession and has mastered this activity. In addition to styling hair, she sells hair extensions to respond well to the needs of her numerous customers. She has run this business since 2002 and enjoys it. One person helps her.
