Nataliya was also able to expand her merchandise selection and improve the family's welfare.  She plans to use this Kiva loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia to purchase various dishware, Belorussian crystal and souvenirs for subsequent sale at her retail kiosk.  This is the period when sales are neither very good nor bad, and this is why she does not have her own means to increase turnover, but needs to purchase enough merchandise to last until December because there are a lot of visiting customers in August.

loans.use: to purchase various dishware, Belorussian crystal and souvenirs for subsequent sale at her retail kiosk

loans.name: Margaritas 15 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARGARITAS 15 DE JULIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gregoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de pijamas, fritura de papa y postre, venta de celulares, venta de ropa, venta de batidos y licuados, tienda de barrio, venta de pescado, venta de fruta.

La señora Gregoria, indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de nuestra institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de frituras de papas, postres y habas, ella cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por su hijastra quien le enseño el oficio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de papa y aceite) mismo que comprará de los almacenes de comercio y posteriormente a la preparación los comercializará de forma ambulante (sin puesto fijo) en diferentes zonas de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es divorciada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de  salud por el apoyo que les brinda.
texts.en:
The “MARGARITAS 15 DE JULIO” comunal bank is in its first cycle with  Pro Mujer, as a part of the Santiago II focal center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors with Gregoria as its president. The businesses that the members of the bank have are varied. Among them we have: sewing pajamas, french fries and desserts, selling cell phones, selling clothes, selling batidos and smoothies, a neighborhood store, selling fish and selling fruit.

Gregoria indicates that this is the second year that she has been a member of Pro Mujer. She joined by invitation of a friend, who is a member of our institution. Right now she has a business selling french fries, desserts and beans. She reports that she started this business because of her stepdaughter, who taught her the business.

The loan that she will rnow take out is to grow her capital (buying potatoes and oil). She will buy these from the bigger stores and after preparation will sell them as a street vendor (with no set sales point) in different areas of the city of El Alto. This type of work allows her to make resources to support her family as much as she can. She is divorced and has eight children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health part of it because of the support they offer.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and oil

loans.name: Glenda Gissella

texts.es: Glenda vive en Paraíso junto a sus padres e hija, tiene 22 años y por circunstancias de la vida es madre soltera. Es este acontecimiento lo que ha fortificado su carácter y la impulso a buscar una manera de ganar dinero. Glenda se dedica a la venta de productos relacionados a la belleza femenina maquillaje, perfume, joyas, sombras, lápiz labiales etc., también vende productos para hombre y niños. Realiza la venta y promoción sola todos los días ya que visita al cliente para recoger los pedidos que le hacen, este negocio le deja buenos beneficios y gracias a él ha podido salir adelante con su hijo. Glenda espera poder conseguir el crédito ya que con el comprara mercadería para la venta, esto lo hace porque desea tener más producción  ya que en próximos meses su hijo ingresara a la escuela por lo que aumentaran sus gastos. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio y llegar a ser directora de una de las marcas que vende.
texts.en:
Glenda lives in Paraíso with her parents and her child.  Glenda is 22 years old, and due to life’s circumstances, she is a single mother.  It is this event that  fortified her character and drove her to look for a way to earn money.

Glenda sells women’s beauty products like make-up, perfume, jewelry, eye shadow, and lipsticks, etc.  She also sells products for men and children.  She promotes and sells her products by herself every day because she visits her customers to take their orders.  This business gives her good profits, and thanks to that she has been able to get ahead with her child.

Glenda hopes to be able to get the loan.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to sell.  She will do this because she wishes to have greater production.  In the coming months her child will go to school, and her expenses will increase.  Her goal for the future is to expand the business and to become a director of one of the brands that she sells.

loans.use: to buy make-up, perfume, jewelry, eye shadow, and lipsticks, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia.  She has previously taken and repayed a loan of 9,000 Philippe Pesos (PHP) that she used to buy merchandise that she resold in her business. Her earnings were a big help in paying for the education of her children, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Delia would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise, to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display, and available on hand, the better. Delia hopes that having more items to sell will result in a better profit.  The income from the business will help her to sustain her daily needs and meet the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Delia hopes to be more successful in her business, and dreams of having her own house and plot through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise ordered for her customers

loans.name: Bronislava

texts.ru:
Бронислава из Новой Каховки. Она пенсионерка и вдова. У Брониславы два взрослых сына. Она арендует торговое место у одного из местных рынков, торгуя мужской одеждой, рубашками и спортивной одеждой вот уже 18 лет. 

Брониславе необходим кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить партию рубашек, маек, футболок и свитеров на осень по выгодной цене. Она планирует дальше развивать свое дело, занимаясь бизнесом и, тем самым, обеспечивая себя и свою семью нужными средствами к существованию.
texts.en: Bronislava is from Novaya Kahovka.  She is a retiree and a widow.  Bronislava has two adult sons.  She has been leasing a retail space from one of the local markets and selling men's clothing, shirts and athletic wear there for 18 years.  Bronislava needs a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia to purchase an inventory of shirts, tank tops, t-shirts and sweaters at an advantageous price for the autumn.  She plans to continue developing her business; thus, providing herself and her family with the necessary means to live.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of shirts, tank tops, t-shirts and sweaters at an advantageous price for the autumn

loans.name: Letty Maritza

texts.es: En la ciudad de Playas vive Letty quien tiene 40 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, su casa es propia y cuenta con los servicios de agua, luz y camino pavimentado. Hace 10 años se construyo un parque en su barrio por lo que era muy concurrido, esto la llevo a ponerse la despensa, con el pasar de los años y gracias al gobierno que regenero el sector para atraer el turismo su sector es ahora conocido como el varadero. En la actualidad su negocio es el mejor ubicado por lo que tiene mucha clientela, labora de lunes a domingos desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, sus mejores días son los fines de semana por el aumento de viajeros. Letty atiende sola el negocio el cual le permite ayudar a sus hijos con las tareas de la escuela. Su esposo es pescador y sus hijos estudian en colegios fiscales. Al momento de obtener el préstamo va a comprar confitería, víveres, gaseosas, con esto mejorar su negocio en ventas y ganancias.
texts.en: In the city of Playas lives Letty, who is 40 and sells groceries. She owns her own home, which has electricity, running water and is on a paved road. Ten years ago, a park was built in her neighborhood and so a lot of people go there. This led to her opening a store and over the years and thanks to the government, which regenerated the area to attract tourists, the place is now known as El Varadero. Right now, her business is in the best location and she has a lot of customers. She works from Monday through Sunday from 8 of the morning until 7 at night. Her best days are on weekends with the increase in travelers. Letty works in her business alone and this allows her to help her children with their homework. Her husband is a fisherman and her children go to public schools. When she gets this loan she is going to buy pastries, groceries, soft drinks and thus improve her business with better sales and earnings.

loans.use: to buy pastries, groceries and soft drinks.

loans.name: Alla

texts.ru:
Алла – вдова. Она живет в Запорожье. Она работает на одном из самых крупных местных рынков города. Алла зарабатывает на жизнь, торгуя кормами для животных и сопутствующими товарами, а именно ошейниками, клетками и прочим. У Аллы 3 прилавка: один собственный и еще два арендованных. Торговлей данным видом товара она занимается уже 8 лет.  
Алла обратилась в Кива за кредитом в размере 21 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сухой корм для животных, консервы и реконструировать свой торговый прилавок, сделав его более удобным для услуг по продаже товаров для животных. Полученную дополнительную прибыль Алла намерена потратить на развитие бизнеса и личные нужды.
texts.en: Alla is a widow.  She lives in Zaporozhye.  She works at one of the largest local markets in the city.  Alla earns a living by selling pet food and pet supplies, such as collars, cages and the like.  Alla has three counters: one is her own and two more leased.  She has been selling this type of merchandise for eight years.  Alla requested a loan in the amount of 21,000 hryvnia from Kiva to purchase dry and canned pet food and to remodel her retail counter, making it more convenient for her to sell pet food.  Alla intends to use the additional profit for business development and personal needs.

loans.use: to purchase dry and canned pet food and to remodel her retail counter

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 60-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and only one child who is still studying. She and her husband collaborate together in order to pay their family expenses and their child’s educational fees. Dalal has been working independently as a babysitter since 2005. She has more than twenty years of experience in this domain. She visits her customers at home and also welcomes some of them at her place. As for her husband, he has been working as a furniture painter. Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate the room in which she babysits the kids. This Kiva loan will improve the place and allow her to attract more customers. In the future, she plans to open her own nursery.

loans.use: to renovate the room in which she babysits kids

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: As a married mother of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the sale of decorative products. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more items such as blouses, pants, bags and other decorative products. Marilyn has sustained her business through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will allow her to save enough money so she can attain her dream of sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as blouses, pants, bags and other decorative products.

loans.name: Alan Uriel

texts.es:
El joven Alan es habitante de Estelí, tiene 21 años de edad, de oficio comerciante se dedica a brindar el servicio de nintenderia en su comunidad, casado, padre de 1 hijo que esta a su cargo, el realizo estudios hasta quinto año de secundaria. Alan inicio su actividad desde hace un año con dinero propio, anteriormente trabajaba  en una empresa privada, de lo que recibió de la liquidación decide poner su negocio propio en su casa de habitación ya que quería ser alguien independiente, este ha sido su primer negocio el cual saca adelante por si solo, Alan se siente satisfecho con su nintenderia porque es un negocio rentable, genera ingresos diarios además cuenta con clientes fijos especialmente los niños que viven en la comunidad y llegan a su nintenderia a entretenerse con los vídeos juegos que les ofrece Alan.
Solicita el crédito   para comprar un televisor, cables de alta definición, lentes para xbox y un disco duro, todos los equipos necesarios para mantener su negocio activo, el dice que el préstamo será de ayuda porque podrá  invertir en nuevos equipos para su nintenderia, que permitirá brindar un mejor servicios a sus clientes, sus planes futuros es ampliar el área del  negocio para mayor atracción de clientes con el objetivo de obtener mas ganancias para el hogar, su meta próxima es llegar a sacar su licenciatura para ser una persona mejor preparada, tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo y obtener otros ingresos para poder salir adelante con la familia.
texts.en:
Alan, 21, is a young man living in Estelí.  He’s a merchant by profession offering Nintendo services in his community.  He’s married and the father of one son who is in his care.  He completed 11th grade.

Alan started his activity a year ago with money of his own.  He used to work for a private firm and used his severance pay to open his own, home-based business because he wanted to be independent.  This is the first business he’s been working on for himself.  Alan feels satisfied with his Nintendo arcade because it’s a profitable business; it generates income daily and he has regular customers especially children who live in the community and come to his Nintendo arcade to entertain themselves with the video games Alan offers.

He’s asking for the loan to buy a television set, high definition cables, Xbox goggles and a hard drive.  All of this equipment is necessary in order to keep the business active.  He says that the loan will be of help to him because he’ll be able to invest in new equipment for his Nintendo arcade that will make it possible for him to provide better customer service.  His future plan is to expand the area of the business to attract more customers in order to earn higher profits for his home.  His next goal is to get his bachelor’s degree to be a better-prepared person and to have better employment opportunities and earn other income to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy a television set, high definition cables, Xbox goggles and a hard drive.

loans.name: Diego Fernando

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, con su pareja y su pequeño hijo de un año de edad; Diego es una persona muy amable, entusiasta y trabajador, que con ayuda de su pareja dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, día a día Diego trabaja como obrero en una empresa de carga pesada de su ciudad, él labora un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su trabajo de vigia cuadrador y cree que le va bien porque lo consideran por su buen desempeño y por su trato amable hacia los demás.
Diego se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de un cuarto en su vivienda, ya que actualmente Diego y su familia viven en una casita construida de esteras y palos, y pasan en la época de invierno cuando la temperatura baja, pasan mucho frío y sufren por las lluvias; de esta manera Diego podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar a su familia y en futuro no muy lejano desea poder tener su casa construida totalmente.
texts.en:
Diego is a 21-year-old man living in the city of Chincha with his spouse and little one-year-old son.  Diego is a very kind, enthusiastic and hardworking person who with his spouse’s help puts all his efforts into moving his family forward.  In his free time he enjoys relaxing listening to a little music and sometimes cooks a delicious “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca” to share with his family.

With much dedication, Diego works day to day as a laborer in a heavy cargo firm in his city.  He works about 10 hours daily and feels good doing his work as a watchman and he believes that he does well because he’s esteemed for the good work he does and the kind way he treats others.

Diego is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to add a room to his house since currently Diego and his family live in a little house made out of matting and sticks and during the winter when temperatures drop they are cold and suffer a lot because of the rain.  In this way, Diego will be able to offer more safety and wellbeing to his family and in the not too distant future he’ll be able to have his house built completely.

loans.use: to add a room to his house.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 50 years old   She is married and has 6 children. Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, like snack foods, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items.

Arlene has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.  Arlene aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like snack foods, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela una pequeña empresaria bastante empeñosa y tenaz, ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y lo ha pagado puntualmente. Durante el ultimo año le han pasado muchas cosas positivas, la mejor de todas es que se casó y actualmente ha adecuado su estilo de vida a su nueva situación, su esposo cuenta con un negocio de agroquímicos y ambos se encuentran con la esperanza y el optimismo de salir adelante y forjar un mejor porvenir para su familia.

Con tan solo 22 años de  edad, Mariela ha demostrado la madurez necesaria para poder trabajar y salir adelante, se dedica a las actividades comerciales desde hace tres años. En su préstamo anterior trabajaba vendiendo cosméticos y actualmente, gracias a su habilidad para los negocios ha instalado en su domicilio una bodega. 

En su bodega se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, bebidas y accesorios que comercializa entre sus vecinos, su carisma y buena atención hacen que su negocio siempre cuente con clientela estable, su esposo la apoya en las actividades que realiza. Actualmente Mariela desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más artículos de primera necesidad, bebidas y golosinas. Con esta inversión ella ampliará su negocio y podrá aumentar sus ingresos, a la vez que ayudará a sus vecinos a agenciarse de productos facilmente, ya que la zona donde residen se encuentra bastante alejada del pueblo.

Mariela desea agradecer a las personas que le apoyaron en su primer préstamo y también desea agradecer de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán en esta ocasión.
texts.en:
Mariela’s quite a tenacious, enterprising businesswoman.  She’s had a previous Kiva loan that she repaid punctually.  During the last year many positive things have happened to her the best of which is she got married and she’s adjusted her lifestyle to this new reality.  Her husband has a farm chemicals business and they are both hopeful and optimistic about getting ahead together and to forge a better future for their family.

At the young age of 22, Mariela has shown the necessary maturity to be able to work and to get ahead.  She’s been carrying out commercial activities for three years.  During her previous loan she worked selling cosmetics and currently thanks to her business skills she’s opened a home-based general store.

In her store she sells basic staple items, groceries, beverages and accessories to her neighbors.  Her charisma and good service lead to her store’s having a regular clientele to depend on.  Her husband supports her in her activities.  

Currently, Mariela wants to expand the business buying more basic staple items, beverages and snacks.  With this investment she will expand the business and be able to increase her income while helping her neighbors to access products easily since the zone they live in is quite far from the town.

Mariela wants to thank the people who supported her with her first loan and also wants to thank in advance those who will support her now.

loans.use: to expand her store.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Aniceta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retail business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of rice and feeds to sell.

NWTF is relisting Aniceta's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice and feeds to sell.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn works hard to support her family. Bebelyn is married and has vegetable business in the Philippines.  Bebelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Bebelyn has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Bebelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional  vegetable to sell

loans.name: Jorge Libardo

texts.es: Jorge tiene 50 años y vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil zona periurbana de Guayaquil. El se dedica a la confección de zapatos de cuero para la venta al mayor y menor. Este oficio lo realiza desde que tenía 16 años de edad ya que lo aprendió de sus padres, al principio solo trabaja de ayudante pero cuando su esposa lo abandono decidió comprar una maquina y poner el negocio de manera independiente. La decisión que tomo fue muy acertada ya que desde ese momento mejoraron sus ganancias y ha podido brindarles seguridad a sus hijos. En su domicilio arreglo su sala donde ubico la máquina de coser y la cortadora, también tiene unas perchas para colocar la mercadería una vez terminada. El trabajo lo realiza todos los días y le ayudan sus 2 hijos en la mañana porque en la tarde asisten al colegio. Con el crédito que está solicitando comprara cuero y plantillas para la producción de las zapatillas. Jorge tiene 4 hijos quienes estudian en el colegio particular su sueño es poder ayudarle a sus hijos con los estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Jorge, 50, lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil, a periurban zone in Guayaquil.  He manufactures leather shoes to sell at wholesale and retail.  He’s been doing this since he was 16-years-old since he learned it from his parents.  

At first, he only worked as an assistant but when his wife abandoned him he decided to buy a machine and open his own business.  The decision was a good one because since then his profits improved and he’s been able to provide security for his children.  

He set aside a room in his house where he installed his sewing machine and the cutting machine.  He also has some shelves to display the merchandise once it’s finished.  He works every day and his two children help him in the morning because they attend school in the afternoon. 

He will use the requested loan to buy leather and soles to make sandals.  Jorge has four children attending private school and his dream is to be able to help them with their university education.

loans.use: to buy leather and soles.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is married and has 3 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emily is 27 years old and has 2 children who are in school.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.  Emily has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Emily would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Sonia Maria

texts.es:
Doña Sonia de 51 años de edad, es originaria de Condega municipio de Estelí, ella además de ser licenciada en Biología es  comerciante,  madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales solo el menor esta a su cargo, Sonia es dueña de una pulpería desde hace 4 años la cual tiene en su casa de habitación. Inicio su negocio con dinero propio que tenia ahorrado pues su deseo era ser alguien independiente, además quería generar ingresos para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, decide poner su propia pulpería, este ha sido su primer negocio en el cual se siente satisfecha pues cuenta con clientes fijos.
Sonia quiere invertir más  en su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes es por esta razón que requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, jabón, huevo, pan, leche, jugos, avena, etc. El cual estima será de ayuda porque podrá surtir su pulpería con productos variados especialmente los mas solicitados por sus clientes, incrementaran sus ventas generando a la vez mas ganancias para la familia, sus planes futuros es ampliar el área del negocio y diversificarse en productos pues desea poder ofrecer materiales de ferretería con el objetivo de tener un negocio mas surtido y poder obtener mejores ingresos, espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva para cumplir sus sueños y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia, 51, is from Condega, Estelí Municipality.  Besides having a bachelor’s degree in Biology, she’s also a merchant and the mother of four children only the youngest of which is still in her care.  

Sonia has been the owner of a grocery store for four years that’s located at home.  She started the business with her own money that she’d saved up because she wanted to be an independent person.  She also wanted to earn income to help with household expenses.  She decided to open her own grocery store which is her first business and which she’s satisfied with because she has a regular clientele.

Sonia wants to invest more in her business to meet customer demand which is why she needs a loan to buy rice, sugar, soap, eggs, bread, milk, juice, oatmeal, etc. that she believes will be of great help to her because she’ll be able to stock her store with varied products especially those most requested by her customers.  Her sales will increase generating more profits for the family at the same time.  

Her future plan is to expand the size of the store and to diversify her products because she wants to start to sell hardware items in order to have more variety and to earn higher income.  She hopes to have Kiva’s support to make her dreams a reality and to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional stock needed for her rice-selling business.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
This is Lanie. She previously borrowed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional supplies of chicken and pork needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to purchase additional supplies of chicken and pork. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her business and pay for personal needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
 
Lanie hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day and will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for meat products needed in her business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is 53 years old, from Baclayon, Bohol. She is a fish vendor in the community of Taguihon. Josefina's husband is a fisherman and whatever he catches from a night of fishing she will sell in the neighborhood in the  morning. She has four children ages 13, 17, 18 and 22. Because of them, she works hard so she can support the needs of her children. She is asking for a loan to buy nylon for fishing net repair, and fishing hooks. She will do everything so that her business will be successful and profitable, making her family's life better. Her income will be for school fees and family daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy nylon for fishing net repair, and fishing hooks

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Rosalina is selling snacks in the school canteen near her family's house. She has run this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients used for making snacks like flour, sugar, cheese, and juices.
Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used for making snacks.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
Rosalinda es una joven de 21 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Santiago, distrito que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, se cultiva el algodón, uva, esparrago, pallares, frejoles, entre otros, asimismo se encuentran muchas empresas agroexportadoras las cuales brindan muchos puestos de trabajo en el distrito. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Rosalinda le gusta mucho leer sobre todo porque la ayuda a relajarse y también a aprender un poco mas cada día, también aprovecha la oportunidad para comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Sopa Seca”. Con mucho entusiasmo logro estudiar la carrera de gastronomía y actualmente sigue estudiando la carrera de Secretariado ejecutivo.

Día a día Rosalinda trabaja en un centro de estudios de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, es muy responsable y sobre todo muy honrada por ello ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo.

Rosalinda está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a ello ella podrá apoyar a sus pequeños sobrinos con los gastos de educación (pago de colegio y útiles escolares) y alimentación  ya que su hermana madre de los pequeños se ha quedado sin trabajo y se encuentra enferma, de esta manera ella podrá  ayudar a su pequeños sobrinos y seguir trabajando para apoyarlos en su educación y también esforzarse por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Rosalinda, 21, is a young woman living in Santiago District, a district noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  Farming is common here too especially cotton, grapes, asparagus, white beans and broad beans, among others.  There are also many agro exporters here that provide many jobs in the district.  

When she has free time available, Rosalinda likes to read above all because it helps her relax and she learns something more every day.  She also takes advantage of the opportunity to eat one of her favorite dishes, the delicious “Sopa Seca.”  With much enthusiasm she managed to study Gastronomy and is now continuing with her Executive Secretary courses.

Day to day Rosalinda works at a local school in her city.  She works about 9 hours daily and is very responsible and honest which is why she believes she does well at work.

Rosalinda is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to them she will be able to support her young nieces and nephews with their education expenses (tuition and school supplies) and with food since her sister, the mother of these little ones, has lost her job and is ill.  In this way she will be able to help her little nieces and nephews and continue working to support their schooling while at the same time striving to make her greatest dream a reality: “To finish her career and support her family.”

loans.use: to pay school fees and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Amia

texts.en:
This is Amia, 66, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Jaime, and a father to her children.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.

Amia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of her sewing machine. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Amia hopes her business will expand and grow into a mini-grocery through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. Teresita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for  5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder sembrar una manzana de maíz, ya que están en la temporada de iniciar la preparación del terreno y para esto deberá comprarse el abono, herbicidas, y otros materiales necesarios para preparar el terreno y para aplicarlos a la siembra, esto le ayudara a María a prevenir de las plagas y fortalecer la siembra. 
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, mejoro su condición del cultivo, aumentando la producción y esta producción fue sana, con estos préstamos hay más oportunidades de crecimiento, ella siempre sigue dedicada a la sastreria, pero desarrolla la agricultura como una segunda opcion para obtener ingresos.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan in order to sow a field of corn. It's already the season to start preparing the land, and for this she will need to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and other supplies necessary to ready the land and apply while sowing. This will help María prevent plagues and strengthen the crop. 

María benefited from her previous loan; she improved her farming conditions, increased production, and the crops were healthy. With these loans there are more opportunities for growth. She has always been a tailor, but has also developed an farming business as a second option for income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Jenny Marisol

texts.es:
Jenny, necesita invertir un nuevo préstamo en su negocio, para lograr una mayor variedad en su proyecto de venta, comprandose vitrinas, decoración y en el mejoramiento del local, invertira a prendas encharcadas en oro, plata, y también bisutería, esto le ayudará a darle una mejor condición en el negocio, actualmente cuenta con un lugar fijo en el cual atiende a su clientela.
Considera que con el anterior aumentó su inventario de venta, logró un mejor porcentaje de ganancia y una mayor fidelidad a sus clientes, con su familia ha logrado mantenerse en el núcleo familiar condiciones económicas han sido más favorables.
texts.en:
Jenny needs a new loan to invest in her business in order to expand her sales plan by buying display cases, decorations, and by making improvements to her shop.  She will invest in gold- and silver-plated pieces, as well as costume jewelry.  This will help her get her business in better condition.  She currently has a set space where she sees her clientele.

With her previous loan she was able to increase her sales inventory; she increased her earnings percentage; and her customer loyalty has increased.  As far as her nuclear family is concerned, their financial situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy display cases, decorations, and to make improvements to her shop

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina works hard to support her family. Fermina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Fermina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for 9 years.

In the future, Fermina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is a lovely and beautiful woman. Also she is very clever and smart. 

For 24 years she has been busy with teaching. She works in the school as a teacher of math. She likes to work with pupils and to teach them with all the knowledge which she has. 

She is married and has two children. 

Nowadays her house is in bad condition and she wants to repair the house. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials for repairing her house. She and her family await your help and support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 52-year-old resident of Muranga where she lives with her family of three children, two of whom are still schooling. She has seven solid years in active farming producing tomatoes, vegetables, maize, sorghum, milk and other horticultural products for the local market.

Mary has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water pump and cereal seeds. She says this will boost her horticultural farming and cereals production which will in turn improve her retail business. She adds that the income will improve her family's living standards but notes that fluctuation in milk prices is one of the major challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and cereal seeds.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia. She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to buy things needed for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilia hopes to add additional tricycle units someday and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
This is Bienvenida, 55, a resident of Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Edwardo who is self employed. Bienvenida and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Bienvenida oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, The driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Bienvenida dreams of having another vehicle in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese government. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
This is Catalina, 48, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Crisanto, her business partner, and is a mother to four children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Catalina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells frozen food products. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to pay for a new space she acquired for a new business that she will open. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Catalina hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of providing her children with a good future through all her hard work on the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the rent and maintenance of her new business stall/space.

loans.name: Nelson Lorenzo

texts.es: Nelson tiene 34 años de edad y vive en Libertad, está casado y tiene 5 hijos por lo que su esposo se dedica a su cuidado. La casa donde vive Nelson es de su propiedad construida de ladrillo y cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz. El se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos, inicio esta actividad porque demanda pocos gastos y la había aprendido cuando trabajo en una cantera. Nelson comenta que este trabajo es difícil en cuanto a fuerza física, se necesita estar en forma y buena salud para dar el 100 % en la producción. Tiene varios años trabajando en el negocio pero este será su primer crédito el cual espera conseguir ya que va a comprar la arcilla la cual es la materia prima para la creación de los bloques. El mayor temor de Nelson por el trabajo que desarrolla es las enfermedades ya que el polvo se convierte en un enemigo para sus pulmones, espera no sufrir ningún tipo de enfermedades respiratorias. Su mayor sueño es tener una cantera más grande con la cual aumentaría la producción y podría distribuir a diversos lugares de tal manera que su económica mejore.
texts.en:
Nelson is 34 years old, and he lives in Libertad.  He is married and has five children.  Consequently, his wife devotes herself to their care.  The house where Nelson lives is his own, and it is made of brick.  They do have water and electrical services.

He makes bricks.  He started this business activity because it has few expenses.  Also, he learned how to do this when he worked in a quarry.  Nelson comments that this work is difficult in regards to physical strength.  You need to be in good shape and good health in order to give 100% to the production.

He has worked in the business for several years, but this will be his first loan.  He hopes to get the loan in order to buy clay, which is the raw material used to make the blocks.

Nelson’s greatest fear about his work is the development of illnesses.  This is because the dust becomes an enemy of the lungs.  He hopes he does not suffer from any type of respiratory illness.

His biggest dream is to have a larger quarry with which he could increase production and be able to distribute to different places.  This way his finances would improve.

loans.use: to buy clay.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Khizzle Flakezz

texts.en:
Khizzle Flakezz is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.

Khizzle Flakezz has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Khizzle Flakezz has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
This is Mira. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mira hopes her business will grow into a grocery store in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all the hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en: Clifford, 44 years old and single, lives with his child in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga where he has been operating a motorcycle transport service business for almost five years now, earning PHP 6,000 a month. To improve his enterprise, Clifford is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC, which he recently joined, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Atifa

texts.en:
Atifa likes to spend her time with friends. She has many friends and loves them very much. 

Atifa is a woman who likes to work very much. For more than three years she has worked in the telephone company. She is an operator. She is one of the best workers and all her colleagues respect her. 

She is not married and lives with her parents. Her parents are old and could not repair their house. Atifa is going to repair their house but her salary is small. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials for repairing the living house. She awaits your help and support.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing the house.

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPIRITU SANTO” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Janneth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de dulces, carpintería, venta de vasos, venta de mochilas, venta de juguetes, venta de muebles, venta de cosméticos, venta de pescados, venta de jugos, tejido de mantas.

La señora Janneth, indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de carpintería, ella cuenta que inicio este negocio aprendiendo la técnica de manejo de madera de su padrastro y posteriormente ella inicio su propio negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación de su mercadería (compra de madera) mismo que adquirirá de las barracas, posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
Espíritu Santo Communal Bank will begin its sixth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional office.  It is made up of 11 members governed by a board of directors of which Janneth is president.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses: food sales, candy sales, carpentry, glasses sales, backpack sales, toy sales, furniture sales, cosmetics sales, fish sales, juice sales, and blanket weaving.

Janneth indicates that she has belonged to Pro Mujer for a year, joining on the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a furniture-making business.  She says she began this business by learning the technique of using wood from her stepfather and later she began her own business.

The loan she will get now is to expand her merchandise (to buy wood), which she will get from the stalls.  After making it she will sell it in her sales space.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, since she is married.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Jessica Beatriz

texts.es: JESSICA TIENE 27 AÑOS,ES SOLTERA Y DOMICILIA  EL DISTRITO DE TUCUME, EN EL NORTE DEL PERU. ELLA E SJOVEN Y CON MUCHA ENERGIA Y ACTUALMENTE SE HA PROPUESTO EN INCREMENTAR SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE ANIMALES Y COMPRAR MATERIALES PARA CONFECCION DE PRENDAS DE VESTIR. PRECISAMENTE LA ACTIVIDAD COMERCIAL QUE ELLA A LOGRADO ESPECILIZARSE ES BRINDAR SERVICIO DE COSTURA, ADEMAS A LA VENTA DE  ANIMALES, CCONTANDO CON EXPERIENCIA DE 8  AÑOS EN EL NEGOCIO. ELLA DISFRUTA MUCHO DE SU RUBRO COMO COSTURERA Y TIENE UN NEGOCIO UBICADO EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO QUE  CUENTA CON CLIENTELA  FIJA(Comerciantes de mercados). VIENDO BUENOS PROSPECTOS PARA SUS ACTIVIDADED JESSICA BUSCA UN PRESTAMO DE 2000 SOLES EN EDPYME ALTERNATIVA CON EL APOYO DE KIVA. EL PRESTAMO SE DESTINARA PARA COMPRA  DE  MATERIALES PARA CONFECCION DE ROPA, ADEMAS PARA COMPRA DE ANIMALES Y ALIMENTO DE LOS MISMOS.
texts.en:
Jessica, 27, is single and lives in the district of Túcume, in the north of Peru.  She's young and has a lot of energy.

Currently she has decided to expand her business selling animals and to buy materials to make clothing.  The business activity in which she has specialized is tailoring services.  She also sells animals, and has eight years of experience in the business.  She enjoys her work as a seamstress and has a business located in her own home with a stable clientele (market vendors).

Seeing good prospects for her work, Jessica is looking for a loan for 2000 soles [PEN] from Edpyme Alternativa with the support of Kiva.  The loan will be used to buy materials to make clothing and to buy animals and feed.

loans.use: to buy materials to make clothing and to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.ru:
Магдалина – пенсионерка, ей 59 лет. Она не довольствуется мизерной пенсией, но стремится подзаработать: выпекает соленики (вкусные вафли, выпеченные по западно-украинскому рецепту) дома и затем продает их в маленькие магазинчики по соседству. У Магдалины полно забот: она старается финансово помочь своим детям и внукам, особенно одной из своей дочерей, которая недавно развелась. 
Магдалине необходим потребительский кредит в размере 5000 гривен с целью приобретения котла на дрова для экономии газа при отоплении дома. Магдалина не может много зарабатывать, чтобы обеспечивать свою семью так, как ей бы того хотелось. Поэтому она стремится минимизировать затраты своей семьи, старается ради их блага.
texts.en: Magdalina is a retiree, who is 59 years old.  She is not satisfied with the miserly pension and tries to earn more money by baking soleniki (tasty waffles, baked according to a western Ukrainian recipe) at home and then selling them to small stores in the neighborhood.  Magdalina has a lot of responsibilities: she tries to provide financial support to her children and grandchildren, especially to one of her daughters, who recently got divorced.  Magdalina needs a consumer loan in the amount of 5,000 hryvnia to purchase a boiler for wood in order to save money on gas when heating the house.  Magdalina cannot earn a lot to provide for her family as she would have wanted.  This is why she strives to minimize her family's expenses and tries for their benefit.

loans.use: to purchase a boiler for wood in order to save money on gas when heating the house

loans.name: L’Amour Group

texts.fr: Le groupe L’AMOUR est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie Ayaba est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Âgée de 45 ans, Marie Ayaba a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Marie Ayaba est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Marie Ayaba vit seule. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Afin d‘assurer ses divers besoins, Marie Ayaba vend depuis quinze ans, des tissus par le système de distribution. Marie Ayaba s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Marie Ayaba sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe L’AMOUR, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The L’Amour (“love”) group has three female members, who are all friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Marie Ayaba, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. She is 45 years of age, and left her studies during high school. 

Marie Ayaba is married to Jean, and together the couple has one child who is at school and under their care. Marie Ayaba lives by herself, and the couple is responsible for the various household expenses. To provide for herself, for the past 15 years Marie Ayaba has sold fabrics via the distribution system. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

To ensure her customers’ satisfaction and increase her sales and income, Marie Ayaba and the other members of the L’Amour group have requested a loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: Ramatou Eveline

texts.fr: Mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé dans une école de la ville, Ramatou Eveline a une baraque où elle vend des produits cosmétiques, des jus de fruits et des produits alimentaires depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et sa clientèle est composée des nigérians et des béninois. Dans le souci de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Le gain dégagé lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de son enfant et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Ramatou Eveline is a married mother of one child who goes to school in the town. She has a shack where she sells cosmetic products, fruit juices and food products, and has done so for several years now. She gets her supplies in one of the markets in Benin, and her customers are from Nigeria and Benin.

To increase her working capital and satisfy the requests of her ever-growing customer base, Ramatou Eveline has applied for and obtained a loan from Finadev. With her profits she will be able to provide for her child’s schooling and other needs.

loans.use: To buy one dozen ointments, two dozen perfumes, a dozen soaps, one carton of fruit juice and one box of canned goods.

loans.name: Praxede

texts.fr: Praxede est une femme de 40 ans,célibataire,mère d'une fille âgée de 09 ans qui va à l'école.Elle a également à sa charge une autre personne.Elle exerce la profession de sécrétaire informatique dans une petite structure dont elle est propriétaire depuis 13 ans déjà dans une banlieue.le phénomène internet est un phénomène qui est de plus en plus grandissant ce qui se remarque par l'accroissement massif de cyber-café dans la plupart des banlieux.Sa remarque faite du petit nombre de cyber-café présent dans sa banlieue,et afin de pouvoir profiter de ce phénomène internet, elle voudrait ce crédit pour acheter une antenne internet afin d'ouvrir un cyber-café ce qui lui permettra de gagner un nouveau marché donc d'augmenter sa clientèle et par conséquent ses bénéfices. Bénéfices qui lui permettront d'une part de réinvestir afin d'ouvrir un cyber-café moderne en achetant plus d'ordinateurs et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Praxede is a 40-year-old, single woman. She has a 9-year-old daughter who goes to school, and also has another person under her care. Praxede works as an IT secretary in a small business which she has owned for 13 years, and which is located in a suburb. 

Praxede has noticed the lack of internet cafés in her suburb and, in order to make the most of the internet phenomenon, she would like a loan to buy an internet antenna. This will allow her to open an internet café, enabling her to enter a new market and increase her customer base and, consequently, her profits. She will use part of these profits to reinvest and open a modern internet café, buying more computers. She will also use some of the profits to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy an internet antenna.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise and expand goods selection

loans.name: Irene Alfredo

texts.es:
Irene, se dedica al comercio de ganado, esta actividad la aprendió por la necesidad de adquirir ingresos para su familia, el negocio lo inició hace más de dos años realizando compra y venta de ganado, que muchas veces realiza en el lugar donde los ganaderos comercializan, y en otras ocasiones se traslada a otras zonas a poder comercializarlas, él vive con su esposa y una hija de seis años de edad.

Él solicitó un préstamo para la compra de tres terneros y comida para su crianza, adquiriendo el concentrado, este credito le ayudará ya que actualmente tiene una persona que vende esos terneros a un buen precio, le servirá a él para la crianza y a futuro poder venderlos ganándole su margen en el precio.

El objetivo de es continuar trabajando y desarrollándose en la ganadería, también poderse construir su propia casa donde vivir su familia más cómodamente.
texts.en:
Irene is involved in cattle ranching, an activity he learned as a result of having to make money for his family.  This is a business he began about two years ago buying and selling cattle, which he often does in a place where many ranchers sell their cattle, though in other cases he goes to other locations to make his sales.  He lives with his wife and a six year old daughter.

He asked for a loan to buy three plots of land and feed for his animals and acquiring a feed concentrate.  This loan will help him since he already knows a person who is selling this land at a good price, and it will serve him well for the ranching and in the future he can sell them and gain a margin of profit on the price.

His objective is to continue working and developing his cattle raising, and also to allow him to build his own house where he can live more comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to buy three plots of land and feed for his ranching operation.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel, se dedica a la venta de frutas, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, no tiene horario establecido para atender el negocio, ya que depende de los clientes, ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos quienes son los únicos que dependen económicamente.

Esta solicitando para comprar una variedad de frutas frescas para ponerlas a la venta, bananas, peras, sandía, fresas, uvas, esta compra le permitirá a Isabel crecer en el inventario y tener lo necesario para continuar trabajando.

Su aspiración es ir creciendo el negocio, teniendo un mayor número de clientes, de esta manera considera poder recibir la ganancia necesaria para vivir conforme con su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel sells fruit and she has started this activity thanks to her own initiative. She does not work fixed hours in her shop, her schedule depending on her customers. She lives with her husband and their children, the only ones economically dependent on her.

She is requesting a loan to buy different kinds of fresh fruits to sell, such as bananas, pears, watermelons, strawberries and grapes. This purchase will allow Isabel to stock up her inventory and to have what she needs to keep on working.

She wishes for her activity to keep on growing by getting a higher number of customers, as this is how she thinks she will succeed in earning the necessary income to live in a dignified way with her family.

loans.use: To buy bananas, pears, watermelons, strawberries and grapes.

loans.name: Oscar Arnulfo

texts.es:
Oscar, se dedica a la venta de leña y a la construcción, tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su esposa, en casa de su madre, no tienen hijos, él se dedica a la venta de leña desde hace 5 años, lo aprendió con sus padres, ofrece la leña a las vendedoras de tortillas y pupusas.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de  camionadas de leña y también algunas herramientas que utiliza en la albañilería, como palas, barras, sierras, martillos, y otras que le hagan falta para realizar su trabajo, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar sus ventas de leña y el trabajo en construcción.
Él tiene la aspiración de fortalecer el negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y su madre.
texts.en:
Oscar sells firewood and he also engages in constructions. He is 30 years old, he lives with his wife in his mother’s house, and they have no children. He has been selling firewood for 5 years, something he has learned from his parents. He sells firewood to women selling tortillas and “pupusas”*.
He is requesting a loan to buy truckloads of firewood as well as some building tools he needs such as shovels, bars, saws, hammers and other tool he might need for his job. This purchase will help him improve his firewood sales as well as his construction works
He wishes to strengthen his activity and to provide a better standard of living to his wife and his mother.

*Pupusas are a traditional Salvadoran dish made of thick, hand-made corn tortilla filled with a blend of either cheese, vegetables or meat.

loans.use: To buy truckloads of firewood, shovels, bars, saws and hammers.

loans.name: Yuritza

texts.es: La señora Yuritza es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien inicio vendiendo repuestos de bicicleta luego invirtió en el comercio de ropa desde hace 5 años. El crédito que solicitó es autoestima para realizarse un chequeo médico de rutina.
texts.en: Yuritza is a resourceful and hardworking woman who started working by selling bicycle spare parts to than change activity 5 years ago to start selling clothes. She will use the loan she is requesting to take care of herself by having a routine medical checkup.

loans.use: To pay for a medical checkup.

loans.name: Shaarbubu

texts.ru: Шаарбубу 53 года, вдова, имеет 7 детей,  проживает в селе Бакыян на севере Кыргызстана со своей семьей. Как и многие в сельской  местности в качестве основного источника дохода, Шаарбубу откармливает скот, начав этот бизнес в 2002 году. На сегодняшний день, хозяйство Шаарбубу насчитывает 27 овец, 1 корову, 3,60 га земли с фасолью, что позволяет получать около 5,000 сом (KGS) прибыли в месяц.  В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Шаарбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку рабочих лошадей. Доходы Шаарбубу планирует вложить в постройку сарая.
texts.en: Shaarbubu is 53 years old, a widow and has seven children.  She lives together with her family in the Bakiyan village in the north of Kyrgyzstan.  Just like many others in rural areas, to provide the primary source of income, Shaarbubu fattens up livestock, having started this business in 2002.  Today her business contains 27 sheep, one cow, and 3.60 hectares of land with beans, which allows her to earn about 5,000 som (KGS) in profit per month.  In order to further develop her business, Shaarbubu requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy work horses.  She plans to invest the earnings into building a barn.

loans.use: to purchase horses

loans.name: Melca

texts.en:
Melca is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Melca has a store that sells different kinds of clothes and footwear. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more stocks of blouses, t-shirts, shoes, and sandals from NATASHA and MSE to re-sell.
Melca has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Melca hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to purchase more products from NATASHA and MSE

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen. She previously borrowed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional supplies of fish needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to have additional supplies of fish and chicken. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her business and provide for personal needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Helen dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish fresh from the ports and piers.

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
Clarissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business weaving nipa ("woven palm mats used for house repair and construction") in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her business.

Clarissa has been in this business for 20 years. Clarissa earns more income from selling fish and vegetables retail.

Clarissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou is 63 years old and he is responsible for four children. He earns a living by selling kitchen supplies in mobile places around the Reussey Keo district, where he has potential customers who use his products. Some of his children serve as his motivation to pursue his retail business. Typically, he is able to earn in the vicinity of USD 6.00 per day as estimated by a credit officer. He uses his earned income to provide daily sustenance, allowances, and education to his school-aged children. Sou wants to work out his plans and expand his merchandise sales to areas far away, where he hopes to double his income to better provide for his living needs.

In order to achieve his business goal, Sou would like to borrow some funds to add to his existing capital to purchase a used pick-up truck which will be used to transport his products (kitchen supplies). Sou believes that he will be able to further develop his business and attain success one day through his effort and the help of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a used pick-up truck which will be used to transport his products.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
María Soledad es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en casa propia ubicada en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Chulucanas, situado en la provincia de Morropón, en la región Piura.

Ella ya ha contado anteriormente con créditos financiados a través de Kiva, anteriormente se dedicaba exclusivamente a la venta de cosméticos, actualmente gracias a las ganancias que obtuvo durante todo este tiempo de trabajo ha podido instalar en su vivienda una bodega en donde ofrece a sus clientes (en su mayoría vecinos del caserío donde reside)diversos productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y bebidas. También se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor (ovino, porcino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Su esposo trabaja como vigilante en un fundo agrícola de la zona.

María Soledad desea adquirir una refrigeradora ya que desea incursionar en la venta de bebidas heladas, este rubro cuenta con bastante acogida en la zona ya que el lugar en donde reside cuentan con temperaturas elevadas la mayor parte del año.

María Soledad agradece el apoyo brindado a través de Kiva hasta el momento.
texts.en:
María Soledad is a head of household, 31 years of age, who lives with her husband and their two children in their own home located in one of the hamlets  making up the agricultural district of Chulucanas, situated in the province of Morropón in the Piura region. 

She has had previous loans through Kiva. Previously she devoted herself exclusively to the sale of cosmetics. Currently, thanks to the earnings she obtained during this entire time of working, she has been able to set up a grocery store in her living quarters where she offers her customers (who are mainly neighbors in the hamlet where she resides) a variety of staple products, groceries and drinks. She also devotes herself to raising small farm animals (sheep, pigs and poultry) which she sells in the local market once they reach the ideal weight and size. Her husband works as a security guard at a large agricultural operation in the area. 

María Soledad wishes to acquire a refrigerator since she wishes to go into frozen drink sales. This line of business has a lot of demand in the area since the place where she lives sees high temperatures for most of the year. 

María Soledad appreciaes the support she has been given through Kiva up to the present.

loans.use: to acquire a refrigerator in order to go into frozen drink sales.

loans.name: Suksur

texts.ru:
Суксур 46 лет, замужем, воспитывает дочь. Суксур в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 20 лет занимается садоводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 6,000 сом (KGS),потраченной на приобретение коровы. Благодаря упорному труду Суксур,в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 дойные коровы с приплодом, ежемесячный доход от продажи молока  около 14,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Суксур обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Суксур планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Suksur is 46 years old, married and raising a daughter.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry for 20 years, having started this business with a sum of 6,000 som (KGS), spent on a purchase of a cow.  Thanks for Suksur's hard work, today her business contains four dairy cows with offspring, and the monthly profit from sales of milk amounts to about 14,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Suksur requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Meriam requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for fishing.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Meriam would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
This is Jolly, She previously requested a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 14,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and finance the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jolly dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Gamira

texts.ru:
Гамире 52 года, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. Гамира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 12 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS), потраченной на приобретение телки. Благодаря упорному труду Гамиры,в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 10 голов овец, ежемесячный доход от продажи молока  около 15,000 сом. К сожалению, младшая дочь Гамиры – Нургуль – больна и большая часть доходов от хозяйства уходит на лечение дочери.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гамира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Гамира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и мечтает поставит дочь на ноги.
texts.en: Gamira is 52 years old, married and raised four children.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry for 12 years, having started this business with a sum of 3,000 som (KGS), spent on a purchase of a cow.
